UP 10.13; putting together, τῶν κώλων Sor. 1.103 (prob.); τῶν χειλῶν συμβολαί, opp. τῆς γλώσσης προσβολαί, of the pronunciation of labial and lingual letters, Arist. PA 660a6; σ. φωνηέντων meeting of vowels in compound words, D.H. Dem. 40, cf. Phld. Po.Herc. 994.28; εἰς φωνήεντα τελευτᾶν ταῖς σ. Arist. Rh.Al. 1434b35.

joint, juncture, [ τοῦ ζωστῆρος] Hdt. 4.10; [ τῶν ἀξόνων] X. Eq. 10.10; of an alchemical apparatus, Zos.Alch. p.139 B.; τῶν ὀστέων, of the joints, Hp. Art. 79, cf. Pl. Phd. 98d, Gal. 2.683, UP 3.16, 16.10; πρὸς τοῦ ἰσχίου Hp. Epid. 5.7; suture of the skull, Poll. 2.36.
twisting, plaiting, τοπείων IG 2(2).1672.311; νεύρων Arist. Aud. 802b16.
point of contact, Arched.Stoic. 3.263; bond of union, τοῦ χωρίου καὶ τῆς γνώμης Aret. SD 1.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: encounter, engagement, συμβολῆς γενομένης Hdt. 1.74, cf. 7.210; συμβολὴν ποιέεσθαι Id. 6.110; τῇ σ. νικῆσαι, ἑσσωθῆναι, Id. 4.159, 1.66; of ships, A. Pers. 350; ἀλεκτρυόνων σ. Hdn. 3.10.3 (pl.); τάλας ἐγὼ ξυμβολῆς βαρείας Ar. Ach. 1210.

children.label: III
children.definition: IG 5(2).419.12 ( Phigaleia), etc.; τῶν ἄλλοθι (sc. συμβολαίων) ἀπὸ ξυμβολῶν κατὰ τὰς οὔσας ξυμβολὰς πρὸς Φασηλίτας τὰς δίκας εἶναι ib. 12.16.13, cf. 60.9, al.; δικάζεσθαι κὰ (i.e. κατὰ) τᾶς συμβολᾶς ib. 9 (1).333.15 ( Locr., v B.C.); συνθῆκαι καὶ σ. πρός τινας Arist. Rh. 1360a15.
marriage-contract, Vett.Val. 40.10 (pl.).

children.label: IV
children.definition: contributions made to provide a common meal, συμβολὰς πράττεσθαι make people pay their share of the reckoning, Ar. Ach. 1211, Eub. 72; τὰς ξ. κατατιθέναι, καταβάλλειν, pay oneʼs shot, Antiph. 26.8, Diod.Com. 2.13; σ. φέρειν, εἰσφέρειν, Alex. 143, Hegesand. 31 (sg.); πίνειν ἀπὸ συμβολῶν Alex. 97, cf. Diph. 43.28.

children.label: b
children.definition: the meal or entertainment itself, picnic, X. Smp. 1.16.

children.label: c
children.definition: τὸν δακτύλιον] εἰς συμβολὰς ὑπόθημʼ ἔδωκε as a pledge into the poll (in dicing), Men. Epit. 287; συμβολὰς or συμβολὴν καταθεῖναι, Luc. Herm. 81, DMeretr. 7.1.

contribution, subscription to the expenses of a festival, etc., IG 12(7).22.28 ( Arcesine, iii B.C.), PTeb. 112.26 (ii B.C.), etc.; διὰ τὸ μὴ πεσεῖν πάσας τὰς σ. because the subscriptions had not all been paid, PCair.Zen. 341 ( a). 19 (iii B.C.), cf. PPetr. 3p.325 (iii B.C.), UPZ 98.139 (ii B.C.): metaph., συμβολὰς διδόναι τῇ πολιτείᾳ Plu. Agis 9, cf. Arat. 11; εἰς τὸν πόλεμον σ. παρασχέσθαι Id. Comp.Dion.Brut. 1.

children.label: V
children.definition: cooperation, dub. in Phld. D. 1.22.

definition: συμβόλησις, εως, ἡ, = foreg. Ι.2, v.l. in Poll. 2.37.

children.definition: a kind of gymnasium, or exchange where contracts were made, Supp.Epigr. 2.509.6 ( Crete, v B.C.).
of or belonging to a συμβολή or a σύμβολον, esp.,

symbolical, figurative, riddling, ἀπόκρισις Ph. 1.617, cf. Plu. Isid. 2.354f; τρόπος τῆς διδασκαλίας Iamb. VP 5.20: Comp., Ph. 2.295. Adv., -κῶς φράζειν by signs, Plu. Garr. 2.511b, cf. Ph. 2.242, al., Gal. 13.272: Comp., Luc. Salt. 59; also, by way of correspondence (cf. σύμβολον III.5), τῷ ἐρωτήματι ἕπεται -κῶς ἡ ἀπόκρισις Stoic. 2.62.
paid for by subscription, πρόποσις AP 5.133 ( Posidipp.); κώθων Antig.Caryst. ap. Ath. 12.547d.
conventional, μετάθεσις A.D. Synt. 187.7, cf. Conj. 226.20; τὸ ἐπικείμενον ἑκάστῳ ὄνομα σ. ἐστιν Syrian. in Hermog. 1.106 R. Adv. -κῶς ibid., A.D. Synt. 314.6: Comp., ib. 8.

data.quote: τὸ ἐπικείμενον ἑκάστῳ ὄνομα σ. ἐστιν

children.definition: -κά, τά, charge for making out a receipt, POxy. 1650a5 (ii A.D.), etc.
-ική, ἡ, mantic art which employs σύμβολα III 2, Gal. 14.615.
confluence of two streams, Schwyzer 664.26 (Orchom.Arc., iv B.C.).
machine which twists cords together, στοιχείων ( σχοινίων cj. Wescher) Hero Bel. 81.13.
to be given to feasting, LXX De. 21.20, Si. 18.33.
given to feasting, Aq., Sm., Thd. Pr. 23.21.

tally, i.e. each of two halves or corresponding pieces of an ἀστράγαλος or other object, which two ξένοι, or any two contracting parties, broke between them, each party keeping one piece, in order to have proof of the identity of the presenter of the other, ἀποδεικνύντες τὰ σ. ἀπαίτεον τὰ χρήματα Hdt. 6.86.βʹ; ξένοις τε πέμψω σύμβολʼ, οἳ δράσουσί σʼ εὖ E. Med. 613 (cf. Sch.); διαπεπρισμένα ἡμίσεʼ ἀκριβῶς ὡσπερεὶ τὰ σ. Eub. 70; ὡς σ. ὀρέγεται ἀλλήλων [τὰ ἐναντία] Arist. EE 1239b31; ζητεῖ . . τὸ αὑτοῦ ἕκαστος σ. Pl. Smp. 191d; καθάπερ ἐκ συμβόλων Arist. Mete. 360a26, cf. GA 722b11, Pol. 1294a35; ἔχειν σύμβολα πρὸς ἄλληλα complementary factors, Id. GC 331a24; ποιησάσθω σύμβολα ἡ βουλὴ πρὸς τὸν βασιλέα τὸν Σιδωνίων, ὅπως ἂν ὁ δῆμος ὁ Ἀθηναίων εἰδῇ, ἐάν τι πέμπῃ κτλ. IG 2(2).141.19.

data.quote: ἀποδεικνύντες τὰ σ. ἀπαίτεον τὰ χρήματα
ξένοις τε πέμψω σύμβολʼ, οἳ δράσουσί σʼ εὖ

children.label: b
children.definition: Plaut. Pseud. 55 (hence σ. = signet-ring, Plin. HN 33.10); an extant bronze hand is inscribed σ. πρὸς Οὐελαυνίους IG 14.2432 ( Gaul), cf. 279 ( Lilybaeum, ii B.C., where the word does not occur).

token serving as proof of identity, ἔλαβε σ. παρὰ βασιλέως τοῦ μεγάλου φιάλην χρυσῆν Lys. 19.25; πολλῶν ἀγαθῶν . . εὐπορήσειν διὰ τὸ σ. ibid.; ὡς ἔγνω . . τὰ παρὰ τῆς γυναικὸς σ. X. Cyr. 6.1.46; τὰ μητρὸς σ. E. Ion 1386, cf. Hel. 291, El. 577, Com.Adesp. 17.16 D., D.S. 4.59, Plu. Thes. 6; ἰδοὺ τὰ σ. here are my credentials, Arr. Epict. 1.16.11, cf. 3.22.99, 4.8.20; ἔχοντες σ. σαφὲς λύπης bearing clear credentials (consisting) of (a common) grief, S. Ph. 403, cf. Aristid. 1.416 J.

data.quote: ἔλαβε σ. παρὰ βασιλέως τοῦ μεγάλου φιάλην χρυσῆν

children.definition: guarantee, σ. τῆς παιδεύσεως πιστότατον Isoc. 4.49; σ. ὅτι παρʼ ἐμοῦ [ἡ ἐπιστολή] ἐστι Pl. Ep. 360a, cf. 363b; σ. τῆς σωτηρίας D. 15.4; σ. τοῦ συμφέροντος εἰς τὸ μὴ βλάπτειν ἀλλήλους Epicur. Sent. 31.

data.quote: σ. ὅτι παρʼ ἐμοῦ [ἡ ἐπιστολή] ἐστι
σ. τοῦ συμφέροντος εἰς τὸ μὴ βλάπτειν ἀλλήλους

children.definition: token, esp. of goodwill, χρυσίον σ. φιλίας καὶ ξενίας Plu. Pyrrh. 20, cf. Art. 18; χρυσοῦν στέφανον ἔλαβον σ. περιέχοντα τῆς ὑμετέρας πρός με εὐσεβείας PLond. 3.1178.13 (ii A.D.).

data.quote: χρυσοῦν στέφανον ἔλαβον σ. περιέχοντα τῆς ὑμετέρας πρός με εὐσεβείας

children.definition: token given to Athenian dicasts on entering the courts, entitling them to vote, and on presenting which they received another σ., in exchange for which they received their fee, Ar. Pl. 278, D. 18.210, Arist. Ath. 65.2, 68.2, Poll. 8.16; also in the ecclesia, Ar. Ec. 297 (lyr.); διάδοσις τῶν σ. IG 2.1749.76: extant theatre-tokens (without the word σ.) in IG 5(2).323 ( Mantinea, iv B.C.).
= tessera, token entitling the bearer to a donation of corn or money, D.C. 49.43.
passport or the seal thereon, Ar. Av. 1214 (cf. Sch.); ἐκπλεῖν μηδένα ἀστῶν μηδὲ μέτοικον ἄνευ σ. Aen.Tact. 10.8: metaph., Arr. Epict. 3.12.15.
passenger-list, ἐμοῦ [τοῦ Ἑρμοῦ] τοὺς νεκροὺς ἀπαριθμοῦντος τῷ Αἰακῷ κἀκείνου λογιζομένου αὐτοὺς πρὸς τὸ . . πεμφθὲν αὐτῷ σ. Luc. Cat. 4.

treaty between two states providing for the security of one anotherʼs citizens and sts. for the settlement of commercial and other disputes (usu. in the law-courts of the defendantʼs city (cf. Harp. s.v.)); εἰσὶ . . αὐτοῖς συνθῆκαι περὶ τῶν εἰσαγωγίμων καὶ σ. περὶ τοῦ μὴ ἀδικεῖν Arist. Pol. 1280a39; σ. ποιήσασθαι πρὸς πόλιν D. 7.11, cf. And. 4.18; τὰ σ. συγχέων D. 21.173; ἀπὸ συμβόλων δικάζεσθαι, κοινωνεῖν, Antipho 5.78, Arist. Pol. 1275a10; αἱ ἀπὸ συμβόλων δίκαι Id. Ath. 59.6; cf. συμβολή III: sg. in same sense, Foed. Delph.Pell. 1 A 7 (also written συββ- ib. 1 B 10, al.); ἡ κατὰ τὸ σ. δικαιοδοσία πρός τινα Plb. 23.1.2, cf. 32.7.3; κατὰ τὸ σ. IG 12(7).67.48 ( Arcesine, iv/iii B.C.), 9(1).331.5 ( Chaleion, ii B.C.); κατὰ τὸ δοχθὲν κοινᾷ σ. GDI 5040.70 ( Crete).

data.quote: εἰσὶ . . αὐτοῖς συνθῆκαι περὶ τῶν εἰσαγωγίμων καὶ σ. περὶ τοῦ μὴ ἀδικεῖν
ἡ κατὰ τὸ σ. δικαιοδοσία πρός τινα

children.definition: contract between individuals, PCair.Zen. 724.7, 13, 790.2 (iii B.C.), PTeb. 5.212 (ii B.C.), 52.10 (ii B.C.); αἰσχρὰ κακοῖς ἔργοις σ. θηκάμενοι forming disgraceful compacts (sealed) by evil deeds, Thgn. 1150; τὰ τῷ Καίσαρι πεπραγμένα κυροῦν συμβόλῳ App. BC 2.132.

data.quote: τὰ τῷ Καίσαρι πεπραγμένα κυροῦν συμβόλῳ

children.definition: receipt, sts. made out in duplicate, σ. διπλᾶ ἐσφραγισμένα PSI 4.324.4 (iii B.C.), cf. PRev.Laws 52.19 (iii B.C.), UPZ 25.25, 26.16 (ii B.C.); τὸ σ. τῆς ἀποχῆς PCair.Zen. 144.2 (iii B.C.); σ. ἀποχῆς PEnteux. 73.4 (iii B.C.); σύμβολον ποιήσασθαι πρὸς αὐτόν PLille 4.18 (iii B.C.), cf. PHib. 1.67.16 (iii B.C.); σ. καὶ ἀντισύμβολα BGU 1741.10 (i B.C.); receipt for a pledged article, PCair. Zen. 120.3 (iii B.C.).

children.label: b
children.definition: fee for making out a receipt, PRyl. 192.10 (ii A.D.), BGU 1605.13 (ii A.D.), etc.
unilateral undertaking in writing, guarantee, PPetr. 3p.164 (iii B.C.), PMich.Zen. 57.4 (iii B.C.), UPZ 112 ii 1 (ii B.C.).

warrant entitling the holder to draw allowances over a period, τοῦ κθ ἔτους τὸ σ. τοῦ ὀψωνίου καὶ τῆς ἀγορᾶς σύνταξον γράψαι PSI 5.504.8 (iii B.C.); σ. σιτικὰ καὶ ἀργυρικά (bequeathed) PGrenf. 1.21.16 (ii B.C.); σφράγισαι τὸ σ. PCair.Zen. 375.11 (iii B.C.), cf. PSI 4.349.2, 7 (iii B.C.), UPZ 14.89 (ii B.C.); τὰ σ. τῶν σιταρχιῶν BGU 1755.5 (i B.C.).

data.quote: τοῦ κθ ἔτους τὸ σ. τοῦ ὀψωνίου καὶ τῆς ἀγορᾶς σύνταξον γράψαι

children.definition: warrant or commission from the Emperor, by which officers held their posts, Cod.Just. 1.5.12.1, 11; σ. τριβούνου ib. 12.33.8 Intr.

children.label: III
children.definition: token, φυλάσσω λαμπάδος τὸ σ. the beacon- token, A. Ag. 8; τέκμαρ τοιοῦτο σ. τέ σοι λέγω ib. 315; μανθάνω τὸ σ. E. Or. 1130, cf. Rh. 220; clue, S. OT 221; χειμῶνος σ. a sign of an approaching storm, Anaxag. 19, Sch. Arat. 832; νόμισμα σ. τῆς ἀλλαγῆς ἕνεκα γενήσεται Pl. R. 371b; ἔστι τὰ ἐν τῇ φωνῇ τῶν ἐν τῇ ψυχῇ παθημάτων σ., καὶ τὰ γραφόμενα τῶν ἐν τῇ φωνῇ Arist. Int. 16a4, cf. 24b2, Sens. 437a15; τὰ τεχνητὰ τῶν σ. Plu. Per. 6; νίκης σ. Ἰσθμιάδος, of the celery-wreath, Call. Fr. 103; τὰ τῶν στρατοπέδων σ. legionary standards, Hdn. 4.7.7; insignia of deities, D.H. 8.38; τῆς βασιλείας Plu. Comp.Cim. Luc. 3; εἰράνας σ. καὶ πολέμον, of a trumpet, AP 6.151 ( Tymn.).

data.quote: νόμισμα σ. τῆς ἀλλαγῆς ἕνεκα γενήσεται
ἔστι τὰ ἐν τῇ φωνῇ τῶν ἐν τῇ ψυχῇ παθημάτων σ., καὶ τὰ γραφόμενα τῶν ἐν τῇ φωνῇ

children.definition: omen, portent, Archil. 44, A. Ag. 144 (lyr.); σ. δʼ οὔ πώ τις ἐπιχθονίων πιστὸν ἀμφὶ πράξιος ἐσσομένας εὗρεν θεόθεν Pi. O. 12.7 (cf. Sch.); οἱ διὰ συμβόλων . . προλέγοντες distd. from other kinds of μάντεις, Gal. 15.442; περὶ οἰωνῶν καὶ σ. καὶ διοσημιῶν Iamb. VP 13.62;= auspicium, Gloss.; ἐν τοῖς λικμητηρίοις γεννώμενα τὰ βρέφη ἐτίθεσαν εἰς σ. εὐτροφίας Sch. Arat. 268.

data.quote: σ. δʼ οὔ πώ τις ἐπιχθονίων πιστὸν ἀμφὶ πράξιος ἐσσομένας εὗρεν θεόθεν
περὶ οἰωνῶν καὶ σ. καὶ διοσημιῶν

children.definition: symptom, Gal. 19.217, Aret. CD 1.4, al.
prearranged signal, ἐπιχειρήσεως Plu. Rom. 14; watchword, E. Rh. 573.

secret code, τὰ μυστικὰ σ. τῶν περὶ τὸν Διόνυσον ὀργιασμῶν, ἃ σύνισμεν ἀλλήλοις οἱ κοινωνοῦντες Plu. Cons.ux. 2.611d, cf. Orph. Fr. 31.23; consisting of a signum and a responsum, Firm. De Errore 18; τὰ σ. [Πυθαγόρου] Arist. Fr. 197, Plu. QConv. 2.727c; περὶ Πυθαγορικῶν σ., title of a work by Androcydes, Iamb. VP 28.145; secret sign, γράψαι τι σ. ἐν πίνακι, . . μαθεῖν τὸν θέντα τὸ σ. ib. 33.238, cf. 23.103, 32.227, Luc. Laps. 5; allegory, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.256, 257, Demetr. Eloc. 243; διὰ συμβόλων μηνύειν Ph. 2.559, cf. 1.681, al., Dam. Pr. 210.

data.quote: τὰ μυστικὰ σ. τῶν περὶ τὸν Διόνυσον ὀργιασμῶν, ἃ σύνισμεν ἀλλήλοις οἱ κοινωνοῦντες

children.definition: religious creed, τὸ ἅγιον μάθημα ἤτοι σ. Cod.Just. 1.1.7.11, cf. 13.

children.label: IV
children.definition: standard weights, IG 2(2).1013.8.

children.label: V
children.definition: small coin, perh. a half-obol, shaped D, Hermipp. 61, Ar. Fr. 44, Archipp. 8: hence σύμβολον κεκαρμένος with half the head shaved, Hermipp. 14.
meeting by chance ( ξυμβολοῦσιν cj. Valckenaer for -οισιν), A. Supp. 502.

children.label: II
children.definition: σύμβολος (sc. οἰωνός), ὁ, = σύμβολον III.2, augury, omen, ἐνόδιοι σ. Id. Pr. 487; ξ. ὄρνις Ar. Av. 721 (anap.), cf. S. Fr. 148, X. Ap. 13, Marin. Procl. 10; dub. sens. in A. in PSI 11.1210.4, IG 42(1).123.34 ( Epid., iv B.C.).
keeper of receipts, PRev.Laws 10.2, al. (iii B.C.).
feed together, LXX Is. 11.6.
pastured in common, Hsch. συμβουάδ<δ>ει· ὑπερμαχεῖ, Λάκωνες, Id. συμβοῦαἱ· συνωμόται, Id.

definition: συμβουλεία, ἡ, written for -βουλία, PSI 1.41.15 (pl., iv A.D.).

children.definition: advice given, X. Ap. 13, Eq. 9.12; σ. Περιάνδρου πρὸς Θρασύβουλον Arist. Pol. 1311a20; official instruction, PFay. 20.18 (iii/iv A.D.).
advice, Pl. Def. 413c.
to be given as advice, Th. 1.140.

children.label: II
children.definition: συμβουλευτέον, one must advise, τισι Isoc. 15.175.
adviser, counsellor, Pl. Lg. 921a, LXX 1 Es. 8.11.

children.label: II
children.definition: βουλευτής) fellow-councillor or -senator, Din. Fr. 89.33; at Rome, D.C. 59.26; in Roman Egypt, PGiss. 34.7 (iii A.D.).

of or for advising, hortatory, opp. βιαστικός, Pl. Lg. 921e; of oratory, deliberative, opp. δικανικός and ἐπιδεικτικός, Arist. Rh. 1358b7; ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη) S.E. M. 2.90; so τὸ -κόν and τὰ -κά, Arist. Rh. 1391b21, Plu. QConv. 2.744e, Philostr. Her. 19.3; τὸ σ. μέρος Phld. Rh. 2.214 S., cf. Stoic. 2.96. Adv. -κῶς Hermog. Stat. 1, Poll. 4.26.

advise, counsel, c. dat. pers. et inf., advise one to do a thing, Hdt. 1.53, 59, 2.107, Th. 1.65, etc.; οὐ συμβουλεύων Ξέρξῃ στρατεύεσθαι advising him not . ., Hdt. 7.46: rarely c. acc. et inf., συμβουλεύω . . συμβῆναι ὑμᾶς I advise that you should . ., Pl. Prt. 337e, cf. Gal. 16.501.

inf., σ. τινί τι Hdt. 1.71, etc.; ὅτι ἂν δύνωνται ἀγαθὸν Ἀθηναίοις IG 1(2).106.19; τοῖς ὀλίγον διαπνεομένοις ἀσιτίαν Gal. 15.508; τινὶ περί τινος Pl. Prt. 319d, etc.; εὖ σ. τινί Thgn. 38; σ. τι recommend a measure, τὰ ἄριστα Hdt. 7.237; χρηστόν τι Ar. Nu. 793; πορείαν X. An. 5.6.12, etc.: but c. acc. cogn., σ. συμβουλάς give advice, Pl. Grg. 520d:— Pass., συμβουλεύεταί τι advice is given, Id. Ep. 330d; τὰ παρὰ τῶν θεῶν συμβουλευόμενα X. Cyr. 1.6.2; τὰ συμβουλευθέντα Isoc. 3.13; τὰ -βεβουλευμένα res de consilii sententia actae, IG 7.413.58 ( Oropus, i B.C., Senatus consultum); of persons, to be advised, ὑπό τινος POxy. 118.3 (iii A.D.).
σ. περί τινος ὡς . . X. Vect. 4.30; σύμ μοι βούλευσον, ποτέρην ἄγω Call. Epigr. 1.5.
advise, give advice, S. OT 1370, etc.; ὁ συμβουλεύων or -εύσας adviser, Arist. Rh. 1354b31, Lex ap. And. 1.96; τὰ συμβουλεύοντα τῶν ποιημάτων didactic poems, Isoc. 2.42.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., consult with a person, i.e. ask his advice, τινι Hdt. 2.107, Pl. Ep. 331a, Thg. 122a, etc.; τι in a matter, Th. 8.68; σ. τι μετά τινος debate a matter with another, Ar. Nu. 475: abs., consult, deliberate, X. Cyr. 2.1.7, etc.— Act. and Med. opposed, συμβουλευομένου ἂν συμβουλεύσειε τὰ ἄριστα if one asked his advice he would give him the best, Hdt. 7.237; [ τοῖς Ἕλλησι] συμβουλευομένοις συνεβούλευσε τάδε X. An. 2.1.17.
= Act., Sch. Hes. Sc. 338, f.l. in X. HG 6.5.34.
agree, make a contract, θύρας λιθίνης ἧς συνεβουλεύσατο κόψαι PMich.Zen. 37.3 (iii B.C.).

definition: συμβουλή, ἡ, = συμβουλία, Hdt. 1.157, 3.1, Pl. Phdr. 260d, Call. in Διηγήσεις vii 19, etc.: prov., ἱερὸν συμβουλή

children.definition: counsel is a sacred thing, Ar. Fr. 33 (v. ἱερός IV.11): pl., συμβουλὰς συμβουλεύειν Pl. Grg. 520d, cf. Din. 1.47.

children.label: II
children.definition: deliberation, debate, εἰς σ. τοὺς φίλους παρακαλεῖν Pl. Prt. 313a; σ. πολιτικῆς ἀρετῆς a debate on it, ib. 322e; ὅταν περί τινος σ. ᾖ Id. Grg. 455c; ἕνεκά τινος Id. Lg. 942a.
goodwill, help, θεῶν Hld. 8.11.

advice or counsel given, esp. in public affairs, Hdt. 3.125, 4.97, al., X. Mem. 1.3.4, Cyr. 1.6.2; ἡ Περιάνδρου Θρασυβούλῳ σ. Arist. Pol. 1284a27; advice of an oracle, ἡ τοῦ Ἀπόλλωνος σ. SIG 633.19 ( Milet., ii B.C.), cf. 590.14 (ibid., ii B.C.): pl., counsels, X. Cyr. 1.6.2, D. 19.5, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: counsel, consultation, λαβεῖν τινα εἰς σ. Men. Mon. 355.

children.label: III
children.definition: prescription, recipe for a charm, Cyran. 16.
advice, counsel, esp. with purposes of evil, Ev.Matt. 12.14, Ev.Marc. 3.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: a council of advisors or assessors, PTeb. 286.15 (ii A.D.), Plu. Luc. 26; esp. freq. of the consilium of a Roman magistrate, governor, etc., SIG 684.11 ( Dyme, ii B.C.), al., Supp.Epigr. 2.265 ( Delph., ii B.C.), Act.Ap. 25.12, Plu. Rom. 14, Apophth.reg. 2.196e, etc.

will or wish together with, συμβούλου μοι θανεῖν E. Hec. 373; ταῦτα X. HG 6.5.34 (v.l.): c. inf., agree with in a wish, τινι Pl. Cra. 414e, La. 189a: abs., consent, Id. Lg. 718b, Euthd. 298b, SIG 364.50 ( Ephesus, iii B.C.); agree together, c. acc. et inf., D. 15.22 (cj.).

adviser, counsellor, in public or private affairs, Hdt. 5.24, 7.50, S. Ph. 1321, Th. 3.42, IG 2(2).832.16 (iii B.C.), PMich.Zen. 57.6 (iii B.C.), Ep.Rom. 11.34, etc.; σ. πονηρός Antipho 5.71: as fem., X. HG 3.1.13: c. gen. pers., oneʼs adviser, A. Pers. 175 (troch.), Ar. Th. 921, etc.: c. dat., καί μοι γενοῦ ξ. Id. Nu. 1481, cf. X. Smp. 8.39; μωρίᾳ ξ. τοῦ κασιγνήτου E. Hel. 1019, cf. Isoc. 2.43: also c. gen. rei, σ. λόγου τοῦδέ μοι γένεσθε A. Pers. 170 (troch.); τῆς ἀρχῆς . . ξυμβούλοισιν . . ὑμῖν χρήσωμαι Ar. Ec. 518 (anap.); τῶνδε σύμβουλοι πέρι A. Ch. 86, cf. Pl. Prt. 319b; ὑπέρ τινος Isoc. 1.35: ξύμβουλός εἰμι,= συμβουλεύω, advise, c. inf., A. Eu. 712, cf. Pl. Lg. 930e: opp. συκοφάντης, D. 18.189.
θεσμοθέται were empowered to appoint σύμβουλοι (perh. in a private capacity), Id. 58.27.
a board of advisers sent with the general, Th. 5.63.
officers at Thurii, Arist. Pol. 1307b14.
= Lat. legatus, Plb. 6.35.4; also used to expl. Lat. con-sul, D.H. 4.76.
to be assessor with, τινι LXX 1 Es. 9.14.
roar along with or together, D.C. 66.22.
wet or moisten together, Gp. 13.3.1.
to be watered thoroughly, BGU 938.8 (iv A.D.), PFlor. 383.88 (iii A.D.).
inundate, irrigate,
ret, [i.e. to prepare (flax, hemp etc.) for further processing by soaking, which facilitates separation of fibers from the woody parts of the stem (Wiktionary)] redupl. pf. σεσυνβρ[ο]χι[σμένης
subject to inundation
retting [i.e. to prepare (flax, hemp etc.) for further processing by soaking, which facilitates separation of fibers from the woody parts of the stem (Wiktionary)]
irrigated, PSI 2.188.9 (v A.D.); opp. ἄβροχος, PLond. 5.1771.6 (vi A.D.).
gnash, ἐπὶ τῆς γλώσσης τοὺς ὀδόντας Iamb. VP 31.194.
cram or huddle together, in Pass., Ar. V. 1110.

sharing the altar, worshipped on a common altar, θεοί Sammelb. 7470.7 (iii/ii B.C.), SIG 1126.5 ( Delos, ii/i B.C.), CIG 2230 ( Chios), Str. 11.8.4, etc., cf. σύνναος; σ. τινί Trag.Adesp. 143, Plu. Frat. 2.492c.
mass of rubble, Hsch. s.v. εὐθυντηρία.
fellow-disciple, schoolfellow, Pl. Euthd. 272c, Gal. 12.835, Ps.-Callisth. 1.13; ἐγένονθʼ ἑαυτῶν συμμαθηταὶ τῆς τέχνης fellow-pupils in the art, Anaxipp. 1.2.

to be mad together, join in madness, τινι with one, Luc. Salt. 83, v.l. in LXX 4 Ma. 10.13; ὁ μαινομένοις μὴ συμμαινόμενος οὗτος μαίνεται prov. ap. Suid. s.v. μετὰ γάρ, cf. Gal. Nat.Fac. 1.15: abs., Men. 421.
soften together, τινί τι Dsc. 1.66 (v.l.), cf. Chrysipp.Tyan. ap. Ath. 14.647e:— Pass., Dsc. 2.63, Lyc. ap. Orib. 9.25.2.

learn along with, share in the knowledge, τινι X. Smp. 2.20; ὁ συμμαθών one that is accustomed to a thing, Id. An. 4.5.27; οὐδεὶς ἐπίσταταί με συμμαθεῖν τόπος no place knows that I have shared its secret, S. Aj. 869 (lyr., s.v.l.; διδάξαι Sch.).
wither together, Phleg. Fr. 36.15 J.
seize or grasp together, συμμάρψας δόνακας μυρίκης τʼ . . ὄζους Il. 10.467; πᾶσαν γενεήν Orac. ap. Hdt. 6.86.γʹ; σὺν δὲ δύω μάρψας Od. 9.289, cf. E. Cyc. 397.

bear witness with or in support of another, ξυμμαρτυρῶ σοι S. Ph. 438, E. Fr. 319 ( συμ-), cf. Th. 8.51; ἐδείκνυε . . βίβλους αὐτῷ συμμαρτυρούσας Gal. 15.444; τι to a fact, Sol. 36, cf. X. HG 3.3.2; σ. τὰ ῥηθέντα τοῖς ἔργοις Isoc. 4.31; folld. by a relat., ὡς . . σύ μοι ξυμμαρτυρῇς οἵα πέφυκα E. Hipp. 286; σ. ὡς . . Id. IA 1158; σ. τινὶ πάντα ὡς ἀληθῆ λέγοι X. HG 7.1.35; σ. τινὶ ὅτι . . Pl. Hp.Ma. 282b: abs., S. El. 1224, BGU 86.40 (ii A.D.).

data.quote: ὡς . . σύ μοι ξυμμαρτυρῇς οἵα πέφυκα
σ. τινὶ πάντα ὡς ἀληθῆ λέγοι

children.definition: to be in aspect with, configurate with, Ptol. Tetr. 124.
configuration of planets, Vett.Val. 49.26.

definition: συμμαρτύρομαι [ῡ], Med., = συμμαρτυρέω, v.l. in Apoc. 22.18.

children.definition: configurate, of planets, Man. 6.393, 441.
fellow-witness, joint-witness, S. Ant. 846 (lyr., pl.), Pl. Ep. 311e; τινος of or to a thing, Id. Phlb. 12b, cf. CIG 3194 ( Smyrna).
chew as well, Hippiatr. 119.
whip or lash along with, αὐτῷ Luc. Ind. 9.

definition: συμμαχέω, aor. συνεμάχησα IG 2(2).10A7 (v B.C.): pf. συμμεμάχηκα SIG 588.61 ( Milet., ii B.C.):—

children.definition: to be an ally, to be in alliance, A. Pers. 793, Th. 1.35, 7.50, etc.: c. acc. cogn., σ. τὴν μάχην IG l.c.: c. dat., SIG 366.8 ( Delph., iii B.C.), etc.; οὐ ξ., ἀλλὰ ξυναδικεῖν join not in war but in doing wrong, Th. 1.39: generally, help, succour, σ. τινί S. Ant. 740, Ph. 1368, Pl. R. 440c, Phlb. 14b, etc.; τοῖσιν εὖ φρονοῦσι συμμαχεῖ τύχη Critias 21; σ. ὥστε . . assist towards . ., Hdt. 1.98:— Med., pf. part. συμμεμαχημένος in act. sense, Luc. Tyr. 7:— Pass., συμμαχοῦμαι ὑπό τινος Id. Cal. 22. Cf. συμμάχομαι.

alliance, offensive and defensive (opp. an ἐπιμαχία or defensive one, Th. 1.44), IG 1(2).52.16, al., Hdt. 2.181, 4.120, etc.; σ. ποιέεσθαι πρός τινα Id. 5.73, cf. 63, X. HG 3.2.21, IG 2(2).43.26, etc.; τινι Th. 1.44, 57; ἡ ἔξω ξ. Id. 3.65; σ. παρέχεσθαι Pl. R. 474b.
the duty of an ally, ξυμμαχίας ἁμαρτών A. Ag. 213 (lyr.) (which others take in signf. II).
συμμαχίαν φρουρεῖν, i.e. συμμάχων χώραν, Th. 5.33.

children.label: II
children.definition: body of allies, Hdt. 1.77, 82, E. Rh. 994 (anap.), Th. 1.118, 119, etc.; συμμαχίας συνελθούσης Aeschin. 2.32.
allied or auxiliary force, Th. 6.73; σ. πέμπειν X. HG 4.8.24, cf. SIG 763.5 ( Cyzicus, i B.C.); ἔξωθεν ἐπάγεσθαι σ. Pl. R. 556e: generally, body of friends, Pi. O. 10(11).72.
of or for alliance, θεοὶ ξ. the gods invoked at the making of an alliance, Th. 3.58; σ. αἵρεσις, νόμος, etc., Plb. 9.23.7, Plu. CG 5, etc.; Σ. [ λόγος] of Isoc., = de Pace, Arist. Rh. 1418a32.

children.label: II
children.definition: τὸ συμμαχικόν the allies, allied forces, Hdt. 6.9, 9.106, Ar. Ec. 193, Th. 3.91, 4.77; τὰ σ. the forces of the alliance, X. Cyr. 3.3.12.
-κόν, τό, treaty of alliance, Th. 5.6; funds of the alliance, συντελεῖν εἰς τὸ σ. Arist. Ath. 39.2.
of a standard authorized by a league, ἀργυρίου συμμαχικὰ τάλαντα πεντήκοντα SIG 826 D passim ( Delph., ii B.C.).

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. -κῶς like an ally, Isoc. 4.104, 8.134, Plb. 15.24.4.

definition: συμμαχίς, ίδος, pecul. fem. of σύμμαχος,

children.definition: allied, νῆες Th. 8.23, X. HG 1.6.29; ξ. πόλις an allied state, Th. 1.98, Isoc. 6.52 (pl.), IG 2(2).43.70 (pl.), etc.; also without πόλις, Th. 2.2, X. HG 7.3.11.

children.label: II
children.definition: body of allies, Th. 5.36, 110; φευγέτω ἅπασαν τὴν Ἀθηναίων ξ. prob. in IG 1(2).10.30.

definition: συμμάχομαι, fut. -οῦμαι X. An. 5.4.10: aor. συνεμαχεσάμην Aeschin. 2.169:—

children.definition: fight along with others, to be an ally, auxiliary, Th. 4.44, 8.26, Pl. Lg. 699a, X. HG 3.2.13: c. dat., Id. An. 5.4.10, 6.1.13; τὸ οἰκὸς ἐμοὶ συμμάχεται probability is on my side, Hdt. 7.239; σ. πρὸς τὸν δῆμον against . ., Arist. Pol. 1300a18; σ. τὴν μάχην Aeschin. l.c.—Prose word, συμμαχέω being used by Poets.

fighting along with, leagued or allied with, τινι A. Ch. 2, 19, Hdt. 1.22, etc.: freq. abs. as Subst., ally, Sapph. 1.28 (fem.), etc.; and in pl. allies, Hdt. 1.102, al., IG 1(2).76.14, etc.; σ. ἐπί τινα X. An. 5.5.22.

Adj., of things, places, circumstances, συμμάχῳ δορί A. Eu. 773; αὐτὴ γὰρ ἡ γῆ ξ. κείνοις πέλει Id. Pers. 792; συντυχίη ἐπεγένετό τινι σ. Hdt. 5.65; νόμον σ. τῷ θέλοντι Id. 3.31; τὸ εἰκὸς σ. μοί ἐστιν Antipho 5.43; τοῦ χωρίου τὸ δυσέμβατον ξύμμαχον γίγνεται Th. 4.10, cf. Hdt. 4.129; πολλά ἐστι τὰ σύμμαχα X. An. 2.4.7; σ. ἔχειν τὸ δίκαιον Lys. 2.10; ὅρκοι καὶ ξυνθῆκαι ib. 62; τάχος σ. εἰς τὸ πραχθῆναι X. Cyr. 3.2.4: c. gen. rei, ἀρετὴ τῶν ἐν πολέμῳ σ. ἔργων Id. Mem. 2.1.32.

data.quote: αὐτὴ γὰρ ἡ γῆ ξ. κείνοις πέλει
τοῦ χωρίου τὸ δυσέμβατον ξύμμαχον γίγνεται
ἀρετὴ τῶν ἐν πολέμῳ σ. ἔργων

children.definition: assistant (esp. messenger), POxy. 1223.10 (iv A.D.), 904.4 (pl., v A.D.), etc.
adapt, D.H. Dem. 45.
participation in, τῶν χαλεπῶν Arist. EE 1245b34.
sway jointly, σκῆπτρα interpol. in AP 15.15 ( Constantin. Rhod.).
change at the same time, Arist. Pr. 940b5; 3 sg. συμμεθιστᾷ (from -ιστάω) Str. 1.3.13.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., with aor. 2 and pf. Act., change places simultaneously with another, Plu. Pyrrh. 16, etc.

definition: συμμεθύσκομαι, Pass., = sq., Plu. Mult. 2.97a, Sanit. 124c.

children.definition: get drunk together with, τινι Phan.Hist. 13, Heraclit. Ep. 7.3.

definition: συμμείγνυμι (freq. written συμμιγ- in codd.), Ar. Av. 701 ( Pass.), E. Supp. 224, etc.; more rarely συμμειγνύω, X. Mem. 3.14.5, impf. Id. Cyr. 7.1.26, etc.; imper. συμμείγνυ Pl. Phlb. 25d; Ep. and Ion. pres. συμμίσγω, as always in Hom., Thgn., Hdt., sts. in Att. ( Th. 7.6, Pl. Lg. 678c, Phlb. 23d) and later Prose, SIG 1025.8 ( Cos, iv/iii B.C.) ( συμμείσγω PTeb. 716.3 (ii B.C.), 12.7 (ii B.C.)): fut. -μ<ε>ίξω X. Cyr. 2.1.11, etc. (v. μείγνυμι): aor. συνέμειξα until iii B.C., PCair.Zen. 545.13, 596.4 (other passages s.v. μείγνυμι), and sts. later, OGI 751.3 (Attalus II, ii B.C.), 763.3 (Eumenes II, ii B.C.), BGU 1784.2 (i B.C.), etc.; -μιξ- first in late iii B.C. (v. μείγνυμι) and freq. f.l. in codd., as of h.Ven. 50, 251, Pi. O. 3.9, etc.: pf. -μέμῐχα Plb. 16.10.1, 38.13.5, Apollon.Perg. Con.Praef.:— Med., fut. -μ<ε>ίξομαι, in pass. sense, Thgn. 1245, Bacis ap. Hdt. 8.77:—

children.definition: mix together, commingle; the Act. first in h.Merc. 81, h.Ven. 50, 250, though the Pass. occurs in Il. (v. infr.); of two things, both in acc., συμμίσγων μυρίκας καὶ μυρσινοειδέας ὄζους h.Merc. l.c.; βοὰν αὐλῶν ἐπέων τε θέσιν συμμ<ε>ῖξαι Pi. O. 3.9, etc.: c. acc. et dat. rei, τοῦτο . . γάλακτι συμμίσγοντες Hdt. 4.23; πῶς κεδνὰ τοῖς κακοῖσι συμμ<ε>ίξω; A. Ag. 648, cf. Pl. R. 415a, etc.; or c. acc. only, ὀργὴν συμμίσγων mixing in, adding, Thgn. 214; συμμ<ε>ίξαντες τὰ στρατόπεδα having combined them, Hdt. 4.114; ἐς τὠυτὸ ῥέεθρον τὸ ὕδωρ συμμίσγοντες Id. 7.127:—rarely in Med., χρώματα συμμ<ε>ίξασθαι Poll. 7.128:— Pass., with fut. Med. (v. supr.), to be commingled, ὅ γε Πηνειῷ συμμίσγεται Il. 2.753; συμμίσγεται τῷ Ἴστρῳ Hdt. 4.48; οὔποθʼ ὕδωρ καὶ πῦρ συμμείξεται Thgn. 1245; σ. θαλίαισι νέκταρ Sapph. 5; οὐρανὸς σ. τῇ γῇ E. Cyc. 578; ἀπὸ πλείστων Hp. Aër. 8; τινι or πρὸς ἄλληλα, Pl. Ti. 83c, 57d; join forces, of two armies, Th. 2.31; to be formed by combination, opp. διακρίνομαι, Anaxag. 17; ἐξ ἀμφοῖν συμμ<ε>ιχθείς Pl. Phlb. 22a, cf. 23d: metaph., εἶναι οὐδένα τῷ κακὸν οὐ συνεμ<ε>ίχθη there is none who has not misery as an ingredient in his fate, Hdt. 7.203; cf. συγκεράννυμι; συμμεμ<ε>ιγμένος Ἑλληνικὸς καὶ βαρβαρικὸς παιών Lys. 2.38; συμμιγέντων τούτων πάντων when all these things happened together, Hdt. 8.38.

data.quote: ἐς τὠυτὸ ῥέεθρον τὸ ὕδωρ συμμίσγοντες

children.definition: unite sexually, couple, θεοὺς γυναιξί h.Ven. 50, cf. 250; λέχος τινὶ σ. Ar. Th. 891, cf. E. Supp. 222, 224:— Pass., συμμ<ε>ιχθῆναι γυναικί Hdt. 4.114; πάλιν ξυμμι<ς>γέσθω Hp. Superf. 26; συμμιγῆναι ἀλλήλοις Pl. Smp. 207b; ὅταν . . συμμ<ς>ιχθῆτον εἰς ταὐτὸν δύο E. Fr. 898.11; Ἔρως ξυνέμ<ε>ιξεν ἅπαντα· ξυμμ<ε>ιγνυμένων δʼ ἑτέρων ἑτέροις γένετʼ οὐρανός Ar. Av. 700.

data.quote: Ἔρως ξυνέμ<ε>ιξεν ἅπαντα· ξυμμ<ε>ιγνυμένων δʼ ἑτέρων ἑτέροις γένετʼ οὐρανός

children.definition: Med. and Pass., associate with persons, Hdt. 6.138; ἀνοσίοισι συμμιγεὶς . . ἀνδράσιν mixed up, connected with ungodly men, A. Th. 611.

τινὰ εὐθαλεῖ τύχᾳ introduce him to, make him acquainted with high fortune, Pi. P. 9.72; χρῆμα δὲ συμμ<ε>ίξῃς μηδενί communicate it not to any one, Thgn. 64; κοινόν τι πρῆγμα συμμ<ε>ῖξαί τινι communicate to one a subject of common interest, Hdt. 8.58; σ. συμβόλαια form mutual contracts, Pl. Lg. 958c.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., in sense like the Pass., have dealings or intercourse with, associate or communicate with, κακοῖσι, ἀγαθοῖς, Thgn. 36, 1165, cf. Hdt. 4.151, etc.; πονηροῖς ἀνθρώποις D. 32.11; Διονυσίῳ Phld. Acad.Ind. p.7 M.; σ. πρός τινα join him, X. HG 1.3.7: generally, meet for conversation or traffic, Hdt. 2.63, 6.23, etc.; σ. τινί talk or converse with, Id. 1.123, E. Hel. 324, Ar. Ec. 516 (anap.), X. Cyr. 8.1.46; διὰ λόγων σ. τινί Pl. Plt. 258a; πρός τινα X. Cyr. 7.4.11; Ἱέραξ ὁ παρὰ σοῦ συμμείξας BGU l.c.; of ambassadors interviewing kings, OGI ll. cc.
Pl. Lg. 930d.

meet in close fight, come to blows, engage, τινι with one, Hdt. 1.127, 6.14, Th. 7.6, etc.: abs., Id. 1.49, 8.104, X. An. 4.6.24; also σ. τῇ ναυμαχίῃ Hdt. 1.166; σ. τινὶ ἐς μάχην Id. 4.127, etc.; σ. ὁμόσε τισί X. Cyr. 7.1.26; σ. εἰς χεῖράς τινι ib. 2.1.11; of ships, Th. 2.84: c. acc., νείκεα συνμείσχιν ( συμμείξειν) πόλεμόν θʼ ἅμα IG 1(2).920.
meet, τοῖς ἄλλοις εἰς λιμένα X. An. 6.3.24, cf. PEleph. 29.11 (iii B.C.), etc.; θάλατται πρὸς ἀλλήλας σ. Arist. Mete. 354a1; ποταμοὶ σ. ἀλλήλοις D.S. 2.37.
one must commingle, Pl. Phlb. 62e, Lg. 828c.

ον, also η, ον Stob. 3.17.28 (v.l.):— commingled, promiscuous, καρπός Hes. Op. 563; σύμμεικτα . . βουκόλων φρουρήματα S. Aj. 53; θηρώμενοι ξύμμικτα μὴ δίκαια καὶ δίκαιʼ ὁμοῦ E. Fr. 419; σ. εἶδος, of the Minotaur, ib. 996; esp. of irregular troops, σ. στρατός Hdt. 7.55; ἄνθρωποι, ὄχλοι, Th. 6.4, 17; opp. true citizens, Id. 4.106; ξενικὸν ἀργύριον σ. miscellaneous, IG 1(2).310.302; σ. χαλκώματα Lys. 19.27; χρυσία σ. διάλιθα IG 2(2).1388.63; πρόβατα PTeb. 53.19 (ii B.C.), etc. Adv. -τως Str. 1.2.27 (v.l.).

data.quote: θηρώμενοι ξύμμικτα μὴ δίκαια καὶ δίκαιʼ ὁμοῦ

children.definition: θυσίαι τελεταῖς σ. Pl. Lg. 738c.
compounded, ἐκ γῆς τε καὶ ὕδατος Id. Ti. 61a, cf. Lg. 692a; σ. [λόγος] consolidated account, PLond. 3.1157.1 (iii A.D.).
become less along with, Gal. 2.532, 15.726, Ptol. Tetr. 3 (where also Act.), Eust. 834.59.
altogether childish, Lucil. Fr. [5].187 Marx (dub.).
partner in youth, Tz. H. 4.673.
become quite black, καπνῷ Plu. Gen.Socr. 2.587c; become black together with, τῷ δέρματι Phleg. Fr. 36.34 J.
exercise or practise with or together, Antipho 3.4.6, AP 12.206 ( Strat.).
in time, κρότος ἐμμελὴς καὶ σ. Ael. NA 5.13; τῷ ποδὶ κρούων συμμελές Philostr. Im. 1.10: metaph., σ. λόγοις Ael. NA 9.29. Adv. Sup. -έστατα accurately, διαγνῶναι Gal. 18(1).297.
to be eager together with, Διὶ συμμεμαῶτες v.l. for συμμογέοντες in Q.S. 5.105.

definition: συμμεμετρημένως, Adv. pf. part. Pass., ( συμμετρέω)

children.definition: in due proportion, Hp. Mochl. 38, Poll. 4.167.
confusedly, Sch. Nic. Th. 677.

hold together, keep together, αἴτιον τοῦ ἓν εἶναι καὶ συμμένειν Arist. Metaph. 1077a24; of an army, Th. 7.80, Isoc. 4.148, D. 8.46; of two states, οὕτω . . μάλιστα συμμένοιμεν ἄν X. HG 7.1.2; of persons, PAmh. 2.124.1 (ii A.D.).

data.quote: αἴτιον τοῦ ἓν εἶναι καὶ συμμένειν

children.definition: hold, stand fast, continue, συμβάσιες ἰσχυραὶ οὐκ ἐθέλουσι συμμένειν Hdt. 1.74; ξυνέμεινεν ἡ ὁμαιχμία Th. 1.18; ἡ ἀρχὴ ἐς τοῦτο ξυνέμεινεν Id. 8.73; χαλεπὸν φιλίαν συμμένειν Pl. Phdr. 232b, cf. Arist. EN 1133a12; τῷ ἀντιποιεῖν . . σ. ἡ πόλις ib. 1132b34: cf. μένω I.5.
distribute in shares, in Med., πολύπουν κυσί D.L. 6.77; parcel out, Judeich Altertümer von Hierapolis 336.11:— Pass., τὸ πλῆθος ἦν ἑκατέροις -όμενον ταῖς γνώμαις D.S. 37.2.12.

data.quote: τὸ πλῆθος ἦν ἑκατέροις -όμενον ταῖς γνώμαις

children.definition: Med., take share in or with, κλέπτῃ v.l. in LXX Pr. 29.24; τῷ θυσιαστηρίῳ 1 Ep.Cor. 9.13: so in fut. Act. συμμεριοῦσι (v.l. -μετριοῦσι) Vett.Val. 264.20.
Pass., to be divided together with, c. dat., Procl. Inst. 190, Dam. Pr. 271.
sharer, esp. under a will, BGU 600.6 (ii/iii A.D.), cf. Suid. s.v. μερίτην: also συμμερ-ίτης [ῑ], Sch.rec. A. Th. 508: fem. συμμερ-ίστρια, Sch.rec. A. Pers. 703.
share with, c. dat., BGU 993 iii 2 (ii B.C.).
culminate together, Ptol. Tetr. 79, Alm. 8.4, al.
culmination of a star, ἑῷον, as the sun is rising, ἑσπερινόν, as the sun is setting, Ptol. Alm. 8.4.
simultaneous culmination, Str. 1.1.21, Ptol. Alm. 8.4.
pass over together, J. AJ 15.6.6, S.E. M. 10.26, Luc. Nigr. 38: c. dat., τὰ ῥήματα -βαίνει τοῖς προσώποις A.D. Synt. 236.4.

change along with, τύχας χρώμασι καὶ πέπλοις AP 15.46.4; ταῖς ὥραις τὰς διαίτας Plu. Luc. 39, cf. Gal. 15.734; σ. τοὺς τόπους exchange places simultaneously, Arist. Mete. 358b33 (Ald.); σ. τὰς χώρας change their places of abode, Plu. Def.orac. 2.424e, cf. Jul. Or. 1.13d; τὸ γένος change its gender, A.D. Adv. 184.3:— Med., change sides and take part with, τινι Aeschin. 3.165, cf. Luc. Epigr. 14.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., change with or together, Arist. GA 716b4, MA 702b23, EN 1100a28, Str. 10.2.12, Ph. 1.276.
carry away together, τὸν ἀκροατὴν ἑαυτῷ Eust. ad D.P. p.75.32 B.
impart information about a matter, σ. τινί τινος or περί τινος, Plb. 5.36.2, 22.14.7.
contributing jointly, πρός τι Pl. Ti. 46e.
transfer at the same time, Gal. 18(2).888:— Pass., Plot. 4.4.29.
revise a manuscript, Gal. 17(1).854:— Pass., change oneʼs habits along with, τινι Plu. Alex. 47.
partake in a thing with another, τινί τινος J. AJ 5.9.1: c. gen., κινήσεων M.Ant. 9.41; πάθους A.D. Adv. 162.7.
change at the same time, τὸ ἦθος Tim.Gaz. ap. Ar.Byz. Epit. 89.16, cf. Phld. D. 1.24.
change along with, τοῖς αὐτομολοῦσιν Aeschin. 3.75; τῷ συμφέροντι Arist. MM 1209b16, cf. Gal. 17(2).569, 18(2).203; τῷ μεταβαλλομένῳ συμμετέπιπτε θρόῳ AP 9.584.14.
alter along with or together, Philum. Ven. 4.8.
flow away together, Simp. in Epict. p.112 D.
bring into harmony with, τῷ πρέποντι τὰ πράγματα Men.Prot. p.14 D.
make a corresponding change in a thing, τὰς ψυχάς Onos. 13.2:— Pass., change form along with, τὰ πτωτικὰ -ίζεται τοῖς ἀριθμοῖς A.D. Adv. 143.13: metaph., οἱ τοῖς καιροῖς -όμενοι Aesop. 307.

transfer at the same time, in Med., τὸν θυρεὸν συμμετατίθεσθαι πρὸς τὸν τῆς πληγῆς καιρόν shift oneʼs shield at the same time to meet the blow, Plb. 18.30.7:— Pass., change along with, ταῖς τῶν πραγμάτων μεταβολαῖς Id. 9.23.4, cf. A.D. Synt. 239.9: abs., ib. 162.19.
change along with, Sch. Ptol. Tetr. 8.
transfer at the same time, Placit. 4.14.1; σ. τὴν ἀτοπίαν τῷ λόγῳ carry over together with, Plu. Comm.not. 2.1071b:— Pass., to be borne away together, Id. Ant. 66.
take charge of along with, μεθʼ ἡμῶν τὸ σῶμα Is. 8.22.
change position with, c. dat., Alex.Aphr. in Mete. 152.1.

partake of with, take part in with, c. dat. pers. et gen. rei, Βάκχαις συμμετασχήσω χορῶν E. Ba. 63; τινὶ τῆς μάχης, τῆς ἀριστείας, Plu. Pyrrh. 4, TG 4: c. dat. pers., PLond. 5.1660.19 (viA.D.): c. gen. rei, δορός E. Supp. 648; τοῦ ἔργου X. An. 7.8.17 (v.l.); βουλῆς Arist. Pol. 1330a21: abs., Pl. Tht. 181c: cf. συμμετίσχω.
to be raised together with, Str. 1.3.15: metaph., to be excited together with, Phld. Rh. 1.352S.
become shallow at the same time, Hp. Epid. 6.7.1.
walk on air together with, τῷ θεῷ Philostr. VA 6.11.
συμμετέχω, τῆς αἰτίας S. Ant. 537.
emigrate or move along with, εἰς Ῥώμην τινί Plu. Num. 21, cf. Sotion Parad. p.189 W.
migrate, change abodes together with, τινι Ael. NA 12.35; τῷ Ἀἰακῷ . . εἰς Φθίαν Eust. 77.4.
partaking with another in a thing, τινί τινος J. BJ 1.24.6, cf. Ep.Eph. 5.7: as Subst., joint owner, PLond. 5.1733.52 (vi A.D.).
measure jointly or in company, Tab.Heracl. 1.11, 2.10.
include in the reckoning, κόλπος, λίμνη, Agathem. 5.24, 3.10 (both Pass.).

children.label: II
children.definition: measure or calculate by comparison, τὸ αἱρετώτερον Phld. Rh. 2.11 S.:— Pass., to be so measured, Arist. Mech. 853b39; ἦμαρ ξυμμετρούμενον χρόνῳ this day measured by comparison with or calculated by the time of his absence, S. OT 73; [ ἔφθιτο] . . μακρῷ συμμετρούμενος χρόνῳ he died in right measure with ( i.e. having reached to) length of days, ib. 963: abs., οἷς ἐνευδαιμονῆσαί τε ὁ βίος καὶ ἐντελευτῆσαι ξυνεμετρήθη who had their life measured out . . , Th. 2.44; πρὸς εὐωδίαν σ. αἱ τροφαί are calculated to produce, Thphr. CP 6.18.3; σ. πρὸς ἀνδρὸς πνεῦμα is calculated to suit it, D.H. Dem. 43; σ. τινί Luc. Gall. 27; εἴς τι Philostr. Im. 1.28.

children.label: III
children.definition: Med., measure for oneself, συμμετρήσασθαι τὴν ὥρην τῆς ἡμέρης compute the exact time of day, Hdt. 4.158; ξυνεμετρήσαντο [τὸ τεῖχος] ταῖς ἐπιβολαῖς τῶν πλίνθων calculated its height by counting the courses of bricks, Th. 3.20; σ. πρὸς ἄλληλα Pl. Ti. 39c; σ. τὴν δαπάνην, τὰς ἐφόδους, D.H. 4.19, 7.10; τὰ διανύσματα Plb. 9.15.3; check measured quantities, PAmh. 2.59.10 (ii B.C.).

children.label: IV
children.definition: limit, φιλοχρηματίαν Poll. 4.39:— Med., σ. τὸν δρόμον ἐς τὸ ἀνεκτόν τινι Philostr. Im. 2.2:— Pass., συμμεμετρημένον of limited size, Poll. 3.88, cf. 9.24; τῇ τῶν λεπτῶν ἐδωδῇ -ηθείς limited to . . , Iamb. VP 3.13.

data.quote: σ. τὸν δρόμον ἐς τὸ ἀνεκτόν τινι

children.definition: measuring by comparison, ἡ ξ. τῶν κλιμάκων computation of their length, Th. 3.20; τῇ σ. καὶ συμφερόντων καὶ ἀσυμφόρων Epicur. Ep. 3p.63U., cf. Phld. Ir. p.76 W.; τοῦ χρόνου D.H. Lys. 5, cf. Herod.Med. ap. Orib. 10.5.4.

data.quote: τῇ σ. καὶ συμφερόντων καὶ ἀσυμφόρων

children.definition: commensurability, opp. ἀσυμμετρία, Arist. Metaph. 1061b1, cf. 1004b11, EN 1133b18; πρὸς τὴν σ. τῶν καθʼ ἡμᾶς ἀνθρώπων in comparison with, measured by the standard of . ., PMonac. 6.39 (vi A.D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: symmetry, due proportion, one of the characteristics of beauty and goodness, βίου συμμετρίῃ by harmony of life, Democr. 191, cf. Pl. Phlb. 64e sq.; ἡ νυκτὸς πρὸς ἡμέραν σ. Id. R. 530a; ἡ πρὸς ἄλληλα σ. Id. Sph. 228c; of exercise to food, Hp. Vict. 1.2; τροφῆς καὶ ἀέρος Thphr. CP 2.9.13; σ. τῶν λαμβανομένων Sor. 1.94; σιτίων τε καὶ πομάτων Gal. 6.7; τῶν φαρμάκων Id. 13.988; κατὰ μίαν σ. in a fixed proportion, Id. 6.272; παρὰ τὴν σ. out of proportion, Arist. Pol. 1308b12; but σ. πρός τι, also, proportion calculated to produce . . , Pl. Ti. 66d; ἡ τῶν καλῶν σ. Id. Sph. 235e; ὑγίειαν ἐν . . σ. θερμῶν καὶ ψυχρῶν τίθεμεν Arist. Ph. 246b5, cf. Gal. 6.13,15, al.; ἡ τοῦ τῶν γάμων χρόνου σ. suitability, Pl. Lg. 925a: pl., αἱ σ. the proportions, Id. Ti. 87d, Sph. 235d, 236a.

data.quote: ὑγίειαν ἐν . . σ. θερμῶν καὶ ψυχρῶν τίθεμεν

children.label: b
children.definition: suitable relation, convenient size, πόρων Epicur. Ep. 2p.49U.: pl., σ. καὶ ἁρμονίαι τῶν . . πόρων Id. Fr. 250.
a womanʼs robe without a train, PSI 4.341.7 (iii B.C.), Poll. 7.54, Hsch.
of moderate size, Poll. 9.24.
of the same class or standard, PMasp. 310.10 (vi A.D.), PLond. 5.1711.28 (vi A.D.).

commensurate with, of like measure or size with, σύμμετρος σῷ ποδί (sc. ἡ βάσις) E. El. 533; χαμεύνῃ Id. Fr. 676; βόστρυχον . . σύμμετρον τῷ σῷ κάρᾳ exactly like it, A. Ch. 230: esp. of Time, commensurate with, keeping even with, δαλὸν ἥλικα ξύμμετρόν τε διαὶ βίου ib. 610 (lyr.); τῷδε τἀνδρὶ σ. being of like age with him, S. OT 1113; ποίᾳ ξύμμετρος προὔβην τύχῃ; coincident with what chance have I come? i.e. in the very nick of time, Id. Ant. 387, cf. E. Alc. 26 (infr. III).

having a common measure, σύμμετροι αἱ τῷ αὐτῷ μέτρῳ μετρούμεναι (sc. γραμμαί) Arist. LI 968b6; freq. denied of the relation between the diagonal of a square and its side, Id. APo. 71b27, APr. 41a26, Ph. 221b25, Rh. 1392a18; [ τὸ νόμισμα] πάντα ποιεῖ σύμμετρα commensurable, Id. EN 1133b22; μήκει οὐ σύμμετροι τῇ ποδιαίᾳ not lineally commensurate with the one-foot side, Pl. Tht. 147d, cf. 148b: Comp., of musical intervals, ταῖς αἰσθήσεσιν εὐληπτότερα τὰ -ότερα Ptol. Harm. 1.10.
in accord with the metre, S. Eleg. 1; σύμμετροι ἐπεκτύπεον ποδῶν χορείαις in time, Tim. Pers. 213.

children.label: II
children.definition: in measure with, proportionable, exactly suitable, λόγοι ἀνδράσι σ. Isoc. 4.83, cf. 5.110, 12.135; γῆ θηρίοις μᾶλλον ἢ ἀνθρώποις σ. Str. 15.1.26; σ. πρός τι Pl. Lg. 625d, Metrod. Fr. 1, etc.; c. dat., Pl. Men. 76d, Ti. 67c, Epicur. Fr. 81 ( Comp.).

in right measure, in due proportion, symmetrical, opp. ὑπερβάλλων and ἐλλείπων, Arist. EN 1104a18, al.; τὸ σ. καὶ καλόν Pl. Phlb. 66b; τῶν φύσει ξηροτέρων . . ὡς πρὸς τὸν σ. παραβάλλειν Gal. 6.360, cf. 27, al.

data.quote: τῶν φύσει ξηροτέρων . . ὡς πρὸς τὸν σ. παραβάλλειν

children.definition: fitting, meet, due, ξύμμετρον δʼ ἔπος λέγω A. Eu. 532 (lyr.); δένδρον πολυκαρπότερον τοῦ συμμέτρου Pl. Ti. 86c, cf. Phld. Rh. 1.288S., al.; ξύμμετρος ὡς κλύειν within fit distance for hearing, S. OT 84.

moderate, πόνοι Isoc. 1.12; ὥστε σύμμετρον . . τὸ πνεῦμα . . ποιεῖν Antiph. 202.16; σ. τροφαί Sor. 1.26, cf. 49, al.; σ. στέγη moderate in size, X. Oec. 8.13; of suitable size, σκῆπτρον OGI 56.62 ( Canopus, iii B.C.).

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. -τρως in moderation, Isoc. 1.32, etc.; in due time, ἀφίκετο E. Alc. 26; σ. πρὸς ἑωυτόν conveniently, Hp. Off. 3; σ. ἔχειν πρός τι to be in proportion to . ., X. Eq. 1.16; εἴς τι Arist. Mir. 834a15; σ. ἴσχειν λεπτότητος καὶ πάχους Pl. Ti. 85c; τὸ μετὰ νοῦ καὶ τὸ σ. Nicom.Com. 1.36; = μετρίως, φέρειν IG 12(7).396.31 ( Amorgos, ii B.C.), cf. Aristid.Quint. 2.5. Comp. -ότερον more fittingly, D. 61.27 (v.l. -ώτερον).
period when the moon does not shine, Peripl.M.Rubr. 46 codd. ( νεομηνία cj. Müller): pl., Theo Sm. p.194 H.
monthly, σύνοδος Theo Sm. p.194 H.
colleague on the monthly committee of ναοποιοί Supp.Epigr. 4.535.16, 536 ( Ephesus).
meeting of the thighs, Sor. 1.103 (pl.).
with the thighs closed, μηροὶ σ. Hp. Art. 77, Hippiatr. 14; = compernis, Gloss.
wind together, connect, M.Ant. 8.23 ( Pass.).
winding together, connexion, M.Ant. 4.40.
fellow-counsellor, A.R. 1.228; συμμήστορα Μοίρην Orph. Fr. 47 adn. 14.
take counsel with or together, Il. 10.197.
help to provide or procure, τὰ ἐπιτήδειά τισι X. Cyr. 1.6.11; τὰ πρὸς τὸν βίον Muson. Fr. 14p.72H.
form plans with, τινι Plu. Alex. 72.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be mechanically adapted, Arist. PA 687b6.
defile together with, τινι LXX Ba. 3.10, J. BJ 4.6.3.
to be a murderer with, τινι Heraclit. Ep. 7.3.
promiscuously with, c. dat., Hdt. 6.58.

definition: συμμίγδην, Adv. = foreg., Nic. Th. 677, Man. 4.266, etc.

children.definition: mixed up together, commingled, promiscuous, βοσκήματα S. Tr. 762; φόνος E. Rh. 431; τεύχη Id. Cyc. 226; βοή Tim. Pers. 35, Ar. Av. 771 (lyr.); ἠχὴ ἄκριτος καὶ σ. Plu. Tim. 27; ὑπὸ συμμιγεῖ σκιᾷ in a dense shade, opp. ἐν ἡλίῳ καθαρῷ, Pl. Phdr. 239c; σ. δρυμοί Plu. Caes. 20; of water, σ. καὶ θολερός Id. QConv. 2.725e.

commingled with, μελίσσης νάμασιν . . συμμιγῆ . . θρόμβον milk mixed with honey, Antiph. 52.7, cf. Gal. 6.45, 160; πόνοι . . νέοι παλαιοῖσι συμμιγεῖς κακοῖς A. Th. 741 (lyr.), cf. S. Fr. 398; ἀνδρὶ καὶ γυναικὶ σ. κακά common to both, Id. OT 1281.
Sor. Fasc. 19.
commixture, Plu. Fac.lun. 2.922a, Frig. 955a.
coated with vermilion, IG 7.3073.117, al. ( Lebadea).
join in imitating, Pl. Plt. 274d.
joint imitator, Ep.Phil. 3.17.
bear in mind along with, ταῦτα συμμέμνησθέ μοι D. 46.2.
decrease together with, σελήνῃ Philostr. VA 5.2.

definition: σύμμιξ, ιγος, ὁ, ἡ, = συμμιγής Hdn.Gr. 1.525.

children.definition: Phot.

commingling, commixture, πάντων χρημάτων Anaxag. 4; τινῶν πρὸς ἄλληλα Pl. Phlb. 23d, cf. Plt. 309b; αἰσθήσεως καὶ δόξης Id. Sph. 264b; ἡ τῶν γάμων σ. καὶ κοινωνία Id. Lg. 721a; ἐκ συμμίξεως by commixture, Arist. GA 785b5, cf. Pl. Ti. 60d.

data.quote: ἡ τῶν γάμων σ. καὶ κοινωνία

children.label: II
children.definition: sexual intercourse, Id. Lg. 839a, Plu. Num. 4.

children.label: III
children.definition: οἱ υἱοὶ τῶν σ. mistranslation of Hebr. benē hatta` ărūbóth ‘sons of pledges’, i.e. ‘hostages’, through confusion of root with `ēreb ‘mixed horde’, LXX 4 Ki. 14.14.
join with in hating, τοῖς φίλοις τοὺς ἐχθρούς Plb. 1.14.4.
lease along with, PSI 10.1143.31 (ii A.D.):— Pass., POxy. 1637.30 (iii A.D.):— Med. in act. sense, ib. 499.37 (ii A.D.).
feel common hatred of what is bad, LXX 2 Ma. 4.36.
concurrent recollection, S.E. M. 7.279, P. 3.108.
remember at the same time, τῶν ὁμοίων Plu. Cohib. 2.460a; ἵνα -σῃς τίνος μέρος εἶ M.Ant. 9.22:— Pass., Gal. 18(2).327.
fellow-magistrate at Chersonesus, SIG 709.49 (ii B.C.).
one must mention at the same time, Eust. 728.51.
share suffering with, τινι Opp. H. 5.567; toil with, Διὶ Q.S. 5.105 (v.l. συμμεμαῶτες).
impart at the same time: τὰ συμμεμοιραμένα things allotted, destiny, M.Ant. 2.5.

definition: σύμμολπος, ον, = συνῳδός, E. Ion 165 (lyr.), dub. in Ath.Mitt. 24.93 (Tire, Asia Minor).

children.definition: defile or disgrace together, ἑαυτὸν καὶ τὴν αἵρεσιν Phld. Herc. 1289p.60V.:— Pass., LXX Da. 1.8, Iamb. Comm.Math. 4.
reign along with, τινι App. BC 5.54.

holding together, coherence, permanence, [ τοῦ κόσμου] Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.173; [ αἱ ψυχαὶ] τῷ σώματι συμμονῆς ἦσαν αἴτιαι ib. 321; holding together of the divine order, M.Ant. 5.8; σ. τῶν σπερμάτων preservation, Dsc. Prooem. 9; living together, Muson. Fr. 13A p.68H.; in Gramm., close connexion, τῶν πτώσεων A.D. Adv. 202.5.
to be alone with, ἀλλήλοις J. AJ 17.2.4: abs., ib. 3.4.1.

taxation-group of citizens at Athens, formed for the levy of εἰσφορά in 378/7 B.C., and later for the discharge of the τριηραρχία, in 357/6 B.C.; see D. 14 ( περὶ τῶν σ.) passim, and cf. Clidem. 8, Philoch. 126, Ulp. ad D. 2.29; στρατηγὸς ὁ ἐπὶ τὰς σ. ᾑρημένος IG 2(2).1629.209 (325/4 B.C.), cf. Arist. Ath. 61.1; ἡγεμὼν συμμορίας, = συμμοριάρχης, D. 21.157, 28.4, Hyp. Fr. 147; ἐπιμελητὴς τῆς σ. D. 47.22; μετοικικαὶ σ. IG 2(2).244.26 (337/6 B.C.).

data.quote: στρατηγὸς ὁ ἐπὶ τὰς σ. ᾑρημένος

children.definition: division of the Athenian fleet, X. HG 1.7.30.
division of the people at Teos, CIG 3065-6 (ii B.C.); class of ἔφηβοι, PTeb. 316.4, al. (i A.D.).

company in general, δειπνεῖν κατὰ σ. J. AJ 5.7.3; αἱ Ἀσκληπιοῦ σ., of the medical profession, Aristid. 2.20 J., cf. Lib. Or. 1.44, 17.26, 20.3; a class at school, ἔστι τῆς σ. ὁ κράτιστος he is top of the class, Id. Ep. 139.2.
classes in the Servian constitution, D.H. 4.18.
president of a συμμορία, Hyp. Fr. 148, PTeb. 316.6, al. (i A.D.), PSI 5.464.4 (iii A.D.).
to be in the same συμμορία, Hsch.
member of a συμμορία, Hyp. Fr. 146, Poll. 3.53, Harp. s.v. συμμορία.
united in the same μόρα, Θηβαῖοι καὶ οἱ ξύμμοροι αὐτοῖς Th. 4.93.

data.quote: μόρα, Θηβαῖοι καὶ οἱ ξύμμοροι αὐτοῖς

children.definition: common or general aspect of disease, ἡ αὐτὴ ξ. Aret. SA 2.6; ἴκελον τῇδε <τῇ> ξυμμορφῇ ib. 11, cf. 9.
to be conformed to, τινι Ep.Phil. 3.10.

definition: συμμορφόομαι, Pass., = foreg., Lib. Descr. 30.5, Men.Prot. p.67 D., v.l. in Ep.Phil. 3.10.

children.definition: of the same shape as, τινι Nic. Th. 321, cf. Ep.Phil. 3.21; τινος Ep.Rom. 8.29: abs., similar, Luc. Am. 39.
share in toil with, τινι E. IT 690.
contribute to suffering of patient, Ruf. Fr. 69.9, Philum. ap. Aët. 5.119.
initiate together, Plu. Alex. 2 ( Pass.).
one that shuts up his words, Hsch.
closing up, as of the womb, Hp. Superf. 29; σ. καὶ δίοιξις, of flowers, Thphr. CP 2.19.3.

one who is initiated with others, IG 12(8).173.13 ( Samothrace, i B.C.), IGRom. 3.225 ( Galatia), Arch.Anz. 30.88 ( Bulgaria), Phot. Bibl. p.97 B.: fem. σύμμυστις, ιδος, ἡ, acc. synmistin, v.l. for synmysten in Serv. ad Verg. Ecl. 8.78.

shut up, close, of wounds, σὺν δʼ ἕλκεα πάντα μέμυκεν Il. 24.420; of the eyelids, Pl. Ti. 45e; ἄνω κεχηνὼς ἢ κάτω συμμεμυκώς looking up with open lips or down with closed lips, Id. R. 529b (hence, to be silent, ἵνα συμμύσαντες πειθαρχῶσιν prob. in Plb. 30.32.8); also of other openings, as of the os uteri, Hp. Aph. 5.51, Arist. HA 582b19, al.; of pores, Pl. Phdr. 251b; of bivalve shell-fish, Epich. 42, Arist. HA 535a18; of the ‘sleep’ of plants, Thphr. CP 2.19.1, al., Gp. 11.20.3; of shields which ‘give’ under a blow, Thphr. HP 5.3.4; of the double reed of a musical instrument, ib. 4.11.4; of green wood, ib. 5.6.3.
to be foolish together, Sch. E. Ph. 394.
joined together, compacted, Pl. Ti. 45c, 46b, 56e, Gal. 18(2).72.
fitting together, τῶν γραμμάτων prob. in Phld. Po.Herc. 994.25 (pl.); cf. συμπηγία.
fellow-feeling, sympathy, Arist. Pr. 7 tit., etc.; τῆς ἐλαίας πρὸς τὴν ἄμπελον Gp. 9.14.1; pity, οὐδεμίαν σ. λαμβάνειν D.S. 13.57; mea σ. my self-pity, Cic. Att. 10.8.10.

corresponding ‘affection’ or quality, affinity, Ep. 1p.11U. (pl.), al.; ὁμούρησις καὶ σ. of body and soul, ib. p.20 U.; also in Stoic. Philos., affinity, τῶν μερῶν πρὸς ἄλληλα κοινωνία καὶ σ. Stoic. 2.170, cf. 145; in Music, used of chords which vibrate together, Theo Sm. p.51 H.; sympathetic vibration of bronze vessels, Plb. 21.28.9.
affinity, concord of heavenly bodies, Vett.Val. 5.13.
analogy, A.D. Adv. 173.26, Synt. 168.18.
sympathetic affection of the body, opp. ἰδιοπάθεια, Sor. 1.63, 2.22, Gal. 8.30; ἔστι τις [τῇ μήτρᾳ] πρὸς τοὺς μαστοὺς φυσικὴ σ. Sor. 1.15.
to be sympathetically affected, δοκεῖ ἡ ψυχὴ καὶ τὸ σῶμα συμπαθεῖν ἀλλήλοις Arist. Phgn. 808b11; ξ. κεφαλῇ τὰ μέσα Aret. CD 1.4, cf. Gal. 8.33:— Pass., J. AJ 16.11.8.

data.quote: δοκεῖ ἡ ψυχὴ καὶ τὸ σῶμα συμπαθεῖν ἀλλήλοις

children.definition: sympathize with, τοῖς φίλοις Epicur. Sent.Vat. 66.
sympathize in, feel for, ἀτυχίαις Isoc. 4.112 (dub.), cf. Ep.Hebr. 4.15, Plu. Cleom. 1, etc.
feel sympathy, Id. Tim. 14, IG 14.760 ( Naples, i A.D.); ἐκ τοῦ παθεῖν γίγνωσκε καὶ τὸ συμπαθεῖν· καὶ σοὶ γὰρ ἄλλος συμπαθήσεται παθών ( fut. Med. in act. sense) Philem. 230, cf. Phld. Po. 5.33.

affected by like feelings, sympathetic, οὐδεὶς ὁμαίμου -έστερος φίλος Pl.Com. 192; σ. ἐστιν ὁ ἀκροατὴς τῷ ᾄδοντι Arist. Pr. 921a36, cf. Pol. 1340a13; πρὸς τὰ γεννηθέντα συμπαθέστεραι μᾶλλον αἱ μητέρες γίνονται [τῶν τιτθῶν] Sor. 1.87, cf. 88.

data.quote: σ. ἐστιν ὁ ἀκροατὴς τῷ ᾄδοντι

children.definition: exerting mutual influence, interacting, ἡ ψυχὴ καὶ τὸ σῶμα συμπαθῆ Arist. Phgn. 808b19, cf. Epicur. Ep. 1p.20U.; νεῦρα ἀλλήλοις σ. AP 11.352 ( Agath.); sensitive to influence, τὸ ἐν τῇ καρδίᾳ θερμόν . . -έστατον Arist. PA 653b6, cf. Thphr. CP 1.7.4; of the members of an organism, Hp. Alim. 23, Plot. 4.5.8; ὁ κόσμος σύμπνους καὶ σ. αὐτὸς αὑτῷ Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.264; exciting sympathy, χερῶν σ. ὑπτιασμός Phld. Rh. 1.52 S., cf. D.H. 2.45: Sup., PHerc. 176p.39V.

data.quote: ἡ ψυχὴ καὶ τὸ σῶμα συμπαθῆ
ὁ κόσμος σύμπνους καὶ σ. αὐτὸς αὑτῷ

children.definition: in concord, Vett.Val. 37.14; defined by Serapio in Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).226.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. -θῶς sympathetically, Phld. Lib. p.37 O., Cic. Att. 12.44.1; τῇ σελήνῃ Str. 3.5.8; σ. ἔχειν πρός τινα J. AJ 7.10.5; -έστερον ἐρᾶσθαι Arist. Mir. 846b9, cf. Plu. Lib.educ. 2.3c; -έστατα IG 12(2).58b33 (Mytil., 1 B.C.).
sympathy, Hp. Praec. 14.

definition: συμπαθία, Ion. -ιη, ἡ, = συμπάθεια, Phld. Mort. 8, Aret. SA 1.8 (v.l.), APl. 16.143 (Antip. Thess.), IGRom. 4.503.19 (Pergam.).

children.definition: collusion, Mitteis Chr. 31 vi 15 (ii B.C.), Gloss.
bring up along with, Them. Or. 9.124a, Or. 18.225a.
teach together, τοὺς υἱούς J. AJ 16.8.3:— Pass., to be educated with others, Isoc. 9.22; μετά τινος Is. 9.28; τινι ib. 37, cf. Plb. 6.44.9.
educate at the same time, εἴς τι X. Oec. 5.13.

play or sport with, ὦναξ, ᾧ . . Ἔρως καὶ Νύμφαι . . συμπαίζουσι, of Dionysus, Anacr. 2.4, cf. 14.4, S. OT 1109 (lyr.), Men. Epit. 261, POxy. 471.82 (ii A.D.): abs., Hdt. 1.114, Theoc. 11.77: c. acc. cogn., μετʼ ἐμοῦ ξύμπαιζε τὴν ἑορτήν keep the feast together with me, Ar. Pax 817 (lyr.): but c. acc. pers., make sport of, PCair.Preis. 2.11 (iv A.D.): so c. dat., BGU 1027.20 (iv A.D.).

definition: συμπαίκτης, ου, Dor. -τας, ὁ, = συμπαιστής, AP 5.213 ( Mel.):—fem. συμπαίκτρια, ἡ, Ant.Lib. 21.1; συμπαίκτειρα, Orph. H. 29.9.

children.definition: senpectas (acc. pl.), = consolers, Benedicti Regula Monachorum 27, Gloss.
playmate, playfellow, Pl. Min. 319e, Ael. NA 14.28:—fem. συμ-παίστρια, ἡ, Ar. Ra. 413, Hld. 2.24, 7.14.
= συμπαιστής, X. Cyr. 1.3.14 (v.l. συμπαίκτωρ), AP 6.154 ( Leon. or Gaet.), 162 ( Mel.).
dash together or against, πῶλοι . . μέτωπα συμπαίουσι . . ὄχοις S. El. 727.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἔριδος συνέπαισε κλύδων E. Hec. 116 (anap.) ( -πεσε codd., Sch.).
sing the paean with another, D. 19.128 ( -παιᾱν- cod. A), Lib. Or. 24.23 (v.l. -παιᾱν-): generally, shout out together, Plb. 2.29.6 ( -παιᾱν-).
wrestle in company with, Plu. Alc. 4; abs., metaph., Plb. 24.13.2; assist in wrestling, τινι Philostr. Im. 2.21; wrestle with an opponent, Gal. 6.316, Longus 2.2.
all the Hellenes together, CIG 3833 ( Aezani).
attend a solemn assembly together, D.H. 4.25, Rh. 2.5, POxy. 1025.11 (iii A.D.): c. dat. pers., J. AJ 9.13.2, Plu. Demetr. 25, Arr. Epict. 3.5.10, Hdn. 4.9.4.
persons who join in keeping festival, Poll. 1.34.
play the knave along with, τινι Plu. Adul. 2.64c.
in all, amounting to a total of, POxy. 513.20 (ii A.D.).
in association, τῶν σ. αὐτῶν,= τῶν μετόχων, Ostr.Mich. 235, 236 (iii A.D.).
go along together, Them. Or. 22.272b.
cram in along with, τινά τινι Luc. Merc.Cond. 32:— Pass., Id. Pisc. 12.
help in canvassing for an office (v. παραγγέλλω IV.2), D.H. 10.58, Plu. Crass. 7.
to be ready at the same time, of crops ripening, Hdt. 4.199.
arrive or be present at the same time, PSI 5.502.24 (iii B.C.); come together, Ev.Luc. 23.48.
come together with, of planets, Vett.Val. 64.22.

children.label: II
children.definition: stand by another, τινι D. 59.72, v.l. in 2 Ep.Ti. 4.16; come in to assist, Th. 2.82, 6.92.
help to move sideways, τὴν γνάθον Hp. Art. 30.

children.label: II
children.definition: lead alongside, τὴν πεζὴν στρατιὰν σ. παραπλεούσαις ταῖς ναυσίν D.S. 14.59.

data.quote: τὴν πεζὴν στρατιὰν σ. παραπλεούσαις ταῖς ναυσίν

children.label: III
children.definition: Pass., to be a parallel derivative, A.D. Pron. 33.1.
show at the same time, incidentally, Str. 2.5.13.
give up along with, Procl. in Cra. p.3P.
run along together, ἄνω κάτω D. 4.41; πεζῇ Luc. Hist.Conscr. 45, cf. Plu. Them. 10, etc.
join in recommending, χρηστὰ τῇ πόλει ξ. Ar. Ra. 687; καλῶς κακῶς πράσσοντι συμπαραινέσαι S. Fr. 576.
join in approving, Ar. Av. 852 (lyr.).
deprecate at the same time, A.D. Synt. 296.19.
sit down beside also, aor. συμπαρεκαθέζετο Pl. Ly. 207b; sit down beside, Them. Or. 22.272b.
sit close beside, ἐν θρόνῳ ib. Them. Or. 15.189c:— Med., make to sit beside one also, D. 28.15.

call upon or exhort together, ἐπὶ συμμαχίαν Pl. R. 555a; invite at the same time, εἰς τὴν θήραν X. Cyr. 8.1.38; ἥρωας σ. οἰκήτορας invite them as . ., ib. 3.3.21; c. inf., σῶσαι Din. 1.65; summon at the same time, ἀπὸ τῶν συμμάχων πρέσβεις X. HG 4.8.13.
make to lie beside, τινά τινι D.C. 60.18.
to be adjacent, Epicur. Ep. 2p.49U., Plb. 6.53.8, Judeich Altertümer von Hierapolis 348:—Gramm., -κειμένη θέσις ῥημάτων καὶ ὀνομάτων of verbs and substantives, as ἱδρῶθʼ ὃν ἵδρωσα, Eust. 477.42.
help in inciting, Isoc. 13.21.
decay simultaneously with, τινι Dsc. 2.180.

follow along or in a parallel line with, keep up with, τινι Pl. Plt. 308d, etc.; ἡτύχη σ. τῷ ἀνθρώπῳ Aeschin. 3.157; ἡ μνήμη σ. τῷ χρόνῳ Isoc. 5.134; σ. τῷ λόγῳ Pl. Plt. 271c: abs., φόβος -ῶν X. Hier. 6.6, cf. Aeschin. 3.233.
bring along the coast with one, τὰς ναῦς, of a naval commander, Th. 8.41:— Pass., of the ships, ib. 39.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., assist in convoying, D.S. 3.21.
bend oneself along with, Luc. Icar. 25.

take along with one, take in as an adjunct or assistant, κοινωνόν τι σ. Pl. Phd. 65b, cf. 84d, La. 179e, Act.Ap. 15.37; τινὰ ἑαυτῷ BGU 226.12 (i A.D.); σ. τὴν ἐκτὸς εὐετηρίαν include in their account, Arist. EN 1098b26; τὰς τῶν προτέρων δόξας Id. de An. 403b22; τὰ ὁμολογούμενα Thphr. CP 5.3.7; σ. τοὺς ἐκτὸς τῆς πολιτείας adopt as partisans, Arist. Pol. 1304a16; call in for advice, φίλους Phld. Oec. p.72J.; in receipts, aor. συνπαρέλαβα received also by me, PRyl. 189.8 (ii A.D.):— Pass., to be invited, Anticl. ap. Ath. 4.157f, Ph. 1.328, J. AJ 15.2.7; σ. ἐπὶ τὰ πράγματα to be called into counsel, D.H. 7.55; to be incidentally involved, Phld. Lib. p.29O.; to be called in to help, Sor. 2.15.
one must bring in also, Arist. Rh.Al. 1442a15, Ptol. Tetr. 79.

children.label: II
children.definition: συμπαραληπτέος, α, ον, to be included also, Arist. MM 1208b6.
disposed to take into counsel, ἑτέρων Phld. Vit. p.24J.
calling in, enlistment, ἑτέρων ὡς συνεργῶν Ph. 1.17, cf. 134.
to be paralysed together, Gal. 8.210.
mix in together, Thphr. HP 9.11.6; also συμπαρα-μειγνύω, Ar. Pl. 719 ( -μιγ-codd. in both).

stay along with or among, Hp. Prorrh. 2.15, Int. 6: c. dat., Th. 6.89, SIG 567 A 12 ( Calymna, iii B.C.); [ γυνὴ] ἀτυχοῦντι συμπαρέμεινεν Men. 325.11, cf. PSI l.c.; endure as long as, τῷ βίῳ Jul. Caes. 324d.
destroy at the same time, D.C. 47.39.
express assent also, Arist. Rh. 1407a37; τοῖς λεγομένοις Aristid. Or. 51(27).33.
swim beside together, τοῖς ἰχθύσι ib. Aristid. Or. 33(51).29; so συμπαρα-νήχομαι, Luc. Tox. 20.
transgress the laws along with, J. BJ 4.5.5 (in Pass.).

escort along with others, τὴν παραπομπήν Aeschin. 2.168; τοὺς πρέσβεις J. Vit. 52, cf. SIG 2848.5 (Delph.); τὰν Πυθαιίδα SIG 3697 G (ibid., ii B.C.); τὸν κῶμον Plu. Alex. 67; τὴν ὄψιν σ. τινί follow him with oneʼs eyes, Id. Ages. 32.
occur to, θεωρήματα οὔπω ἡμῖν συμπαραπεπτωκότα prob. in Archim. Eratosth. p.430H.
sail along with also, Plb. 5.68.9, D.S. 4.18, Plu. Demetr. 19, Arr. Fr. 127J., etc.
expletive, Sch. Ar. Ach. 1.
destroy along with: Med., perish along with or besides, D. 19.175.
escort, Schwyzer 369.25 ( Amphissa, ii B.C., pl.), prob. in IG 5(1).1428.14 ( Messene, ii/i B.C.).

assist in getting ready or bringing about, ὁ δαίμων ἡμῖν ταῦτα συμπαρεσκεύακεν X. Cyr. 7.5.81, cf. D. 18.158; σ. τὰ ἔνδον X. Cyr. 5.3.14; πλοῖα Id. An. 5.1.10; σ. τὸν ἀγῶνα help in providing for it, And. 1.132; καιρὸν σ. κατά τινων D. 23.183; ὁπλίτας σ. ὅπως αἰχμάλωτοι γένωνται Id. 19.230:— Med., συμπαρασκευασάμενος δύναμιν f.l. in Isoc. 5.101.
assist in battle together, Tz. H. 5.227.
join in breaking a truce, Eust. 479.32.
stand by so as to assist, ἑκόνθʼ ἑκόντι Ζηνὶ σ. A. Pr. 220, cf. Ar. Ec. 15, Gal. 19.172: abs., Ar. Ra. 387 (lyr.).
one who stands by to aid, joint helper or assistant, S. Ph. 675, Ar. Pl. 326.
‘throw in’ incidentally, φατικῶς Phld. Mus. p.79K., cf. p.54K.
meeting in battle, Sch.rec. A. Th. 633.
to be set in array with others, fight along with, X. HG 3.5.22; μετά τινων v.l. in D. 18.229, cf. ib. 216; τισι Isoc. 12.180, Lycurg. 144.
stretch out alongside of, τινί τι Gal. UP 16.10:— Pass., to be so stretched out, Id. 18(1).298, Zos. 3.25, Mich. in EN 553.30:—intr. in Act., Plot. 3.7.13, Simp. in Cat. 244.22.
take care at the same time, ὅπως . . D. 16.10; observe carefully at the same time with, c. dat., Gal. 1.137, Aristid. 2.44J.:— Pass., c. dat., Gal. Phil.Hist. 9, S.E. P. 2.100.
observation at the same time, S.E. M. 8.154; of indirect observation, Gal. 1.109, 127.
place alongside, πεζούς Plb. 2.66.7:— Med., deposit a document at the same time, BGU 324.18 (ii A.D.):— Pass., POxy. 1649.10 (iii A.D.).
bring up or keep at the same time, of wild animals kept for hunting, X. Oec. 5.5.
run alongside with, Plu. Cat.Ma. 5, Arat. 7.
happen to be present together, of planets, Cat.Cod.Astr. 6.70.
bring with one, hence, exhibit, exemplify, Phld. Rh. 2.27S.
carry along together with, Ptol. Geog. 1.22.5:— Pass., Plu. Caes. 34; rush along together, X. Cyn. 3.10 (v.l. συμπερι-); follow the same course, of blood-vessels, etc., Gal. 2.391, 822.
grow together, Gal. UP 16.9, Them. Or. 4.56a.
give way together with, τῷ ἡλίῳ Thphr. Vent. 61, cf. Ph. ap. Eus. PE 8.7.
sit beside, τοῖς ἀθανάτοις Sch. Luc. DMort. 1.1.
to be situated together, τῷ δεσπόζοντι τῶν Χρόνων Nech. ap. Vett.Val. 291.20.

to be present also or at the same time, Hp. VM 17, And. 1.12, X. Lac. 2.2, 12.3, etc.; freq. in Pap., PSI 5.509.8 (iii B.C.), etc.; of a desire, Sor. 1.38; of planets, occupy a position together, Vett.Val. 60.21.
stand by, come to help, τινι X. HG 4.6.1; ἐν ἔργοις Phld. Piet. 37; of an advocate, D. 24.158; act as oneʼs representative, PRyl. 120.3 (ii A.D.), etc.
march beside together, impf. συμπαρῄει, X. HG 2.1.28, Aeschin. 2.111.
go in along with, μετά τινος Luc. Tim. 28.

stretch out side by side, apply, τὴν νόησιν τοῖς λεγομένοις M.Ant. 7.30, cf. Iamb. Comm.Math. 14:— Pass., to be coextensive with, Ascl. Tact. 6.2, Gal. UP 12.15, al., Cleom. 2.1, al., Alex.Trall. Verm. p.587P.:— Med., come into competition with, τινι Suid. s.v. τὴν κατὰ σαυτόν.
to be expressed as well, i.e. appear by implication, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.107.
one must carry along with, Them. Or. 22.275a.

go along with, accompany, X. Cyr. 7.1.8, Eq. 11.12: metaph., ὅλῃ τῇ ἡμέρῃ Hp. Epid. 5.89; τιμαὶ . . ἑκάστοις -είποντο X. Cyr. 2.1.23, cf. Hier. 8.5, Phld. Oec. p.53J.; ὅσοις σ. τις Χάρις Pl. Lg. 667b; αἱ -όμεναι ὀσμαί Arist. Pr. 907a1.
pass by together, Ph. 2.513.
assist in causing, φόβον τοῖς πολεμίοις X. An. 7.4.19; assist in procuring, ἀσφάλειάν τινι ib. 7.6.30:— Med., εὔκλειαν Id. Smp. 8.43.
to be present together with, accompany, τῷ αἰσθητῷ τὸ αἰσθανόμενον σ. Plu. An.procr. 2.1024c = Stoic.rep. 1032b.
fellow-maiden, Ael. VH 12.1.
ride along with, τινι D.C. 63.2.
fly along with, Luc. Dear.Iud. [DDeor. 20.]6.

place by oneʼs side together, τᾷ μὲν (sc. Εὐάδνᾳ) . . Ἐλευθὼ συμπαρέστασέν τε Μοίρας f.l. in Pi. O. 6.42; express at the same time, A.D. Synt. 235.11, al.:— Med., set by oneʼs side, τὴν φιλοσοφίαν Them. Or. 7.99d, cf. Or. 34p.450Dind.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., with fut. Med., aor. and pf. Act., stand beside so as to assist, τἠμῇ φρενί S. OC 1340, cf. LXX Ps. 93(94).16, CIG 2056.8 ( Varna), PSI 4.392.13 (iii B.C.), etc.; ἅπαντι δαίμων ἀνδρὶ συμπαρίσταται εὐθὺς γενομένῳ Men. 550; 2 pl. aor. 2 imper. συμπαράστατε Sammelb. 7452.6 (perh. iii A.D.).

data.quote: ἅπαντι δαίμων ἀνδρὶ συμπαρίσταται εὐθὺς γενομένῳ

children.definition: accompany, ψῦξις σ. τῇ ἀπεψίᾳ Herod.Med. ap. Aët. 4.45.
dwelling beside together, Eup. 177.
to have passed by together, S.E. M. 10.201, 202.
slip past together with, τοῖς ὑγροῖς Plu. QConv. 2.699a.

X. Cyr. 1.6.24, App. Ill. 27; of things, accompany, σ. πάσῃ ἡλικίᾳ τὸ κάλλος X. Smp. 4.17; φόβος σ. τινί Id. Cyr. 8.7.7; ὀσμαί Id. Oec. 4.21, Ael. VH 3.1; of symptoms, Aret. SD 2.1, Steph. in Gal. 1.237D.
provoke along with or together, τινα Plu. Herod. 2.859f, etc.; εἴς τι X. Oec. 6.10:— Pass., to be exacerbated at the same time as, λυγμὸν -όμενον τοῖς πυρετοῖς Gal. 15.847.
urge on in addition, Thphr. Vent. 15: metaph., hearten together, τοὺς φιλίους Phld. Mus. p.27K., cf. Nic.Dam. Fr. 130.18J., Plu. Cic. 3; πρός τι Arist. MM 1208a16: c. inf., Ath. 12.519f.
presence together, of planets, Petos. ap. Vett.Val. 80.4, Paul.Al. H. 1: generally, presence alongside, Phlp. in Mete. 48.29.

definition: σύμπας, σύμπᾱσα, σύμπᾰν, Att. ξύμπας ( ξύμπαντα in Od. 7.214, 14.198, though the metre does not require it):—

children.definition: all together, all at once, mostly (in Hom.always) in pl.; υἷας Ἀχαιῶν σύμπαντας Il. 1.241, etc.; σύμπασιν δʼ ὑμῖν, opp. εἷς ἕκαστος, Sol. 11.6; ξύμπαντά τʼ εἰπών A. Fr. 350.3; αἱ σ. ἡμέραι Antipho 6.44; σ. τε θεῶν καὶ ἀνθρώπων Pl. Smp. 197e; συμπάντων κεφάλαιον IG 1(2).91.23; in Att. the Art. is usually added in the case of Numerals, πέντʼ ἦσαν οἱ ξ. S. OT 752, cf. X. An. 1.2.9, Pl. Prt. 317c; but also without Art., ξ. ἐγένοντο τετρακισχίλιοι Th. 1.107.

children.label: II
children.definition: the whole, ὁ σ. στρατός Hdt. 7.82; στρατὸς σ. S. Ph. 387; στρατῷ ξ. Id. Aj. 1055; τῷ σ. στρατῷ Id. Ph. 1257; ξ. λαός ib. 1243; πόλις ξύμπασα the state as a whole, Th. 2.60, 3.62; ὁ σ. δᾶμος IG 12(1).847.15 ( Lindus); τὴν σ. Ἑλλάδα Sor. Vit. Hippocr. 5; σ. ὁ φόρος IG 1(2).64.8; σ. ἡ πόλις Pl. R. 423d, al.; also with some other Nouns, χρόνῳ σύμπαντι Pi. O. 6.56; αἰῶνα τὸν σύμπαντα E. Hec. 757; ἡ σ. (sc. γῆ) S. Fr. 411, cf. Ar. Nu. 204; ξ. γνώμη the general scope (of a speech), Th. 1.22; σ. ἡ ὁδός X. An. 7.8.26; σ. ἀρετή, σ. πονηρία, Pl. Lg. 630b, Grg. 477c; σ. ἀριθμός Id. R. 525a; σ. κεφάλαιον IG 1(2).313.148; κεφάλαιον τόκου ξύμπαντος ib. 324.101; τὸ σ. πλάτος Sor. 1.68, cf. 2.89; but, in Arithm., ὁ σύμπας the sum, Dioph. Polyg. 4 (c. gen., ibid.).--For the Att. position of the Art., v. πᾶς B.
τὸ σ. the whole together, the sum of the matter, τὸ σ. εἶπαι Hdt. 7.143, cf. Th. 7.49; the universe, Isoc. 11.12; the whole, opp. τὸ μέρος, Pl. Phdr. 246c, Arist. Top. 135a22.

children.label: b
children.definition: τὸ σύμπαν as Adv., altogether, on the whole, in general, Th. 4.63, Isoc. 2.17, etc.; so σύμπαντα Pl. Lg. 679e; σύμπαν in all, with numerals, POxy. 289.3 (i A.D.), etc. Cf. συνάπας.
powder for sprinkling, Sor. 2.15, 28, Cael.Aur. TP 3.5.
besprinkle, bespatter, bestrew, Plu. Util. 2.89d, QConv. 638e; βρέφος [ἅλατι] Sor. 1.82, cf. Orib. Fr. 78: also σ. τοὺς ἅλας Sor. l.c.
have the same thing happen to one, οἱ τοὺς χασμωμένους . . ὁρῶντες ταὐτὸν τοῦτο σ. Pl. Chrm. 169c, cf. Ep.Rom. 8.17; θαυμαστὸν . . τὸ συμπάσχειν τὰς τραγέας Thphr. Od. 62.

children.label: II
children.definition: to be affected in common with, ἀλλήλοις Arist. APr. 70b16; commotiunculis, Cic. Att. 12.11; προσώποις, of a mimic dancer, IG 14.2124.3 ( Rome, ii/iii A.D.); τοῖς τῆς ψυχῆς παθήμασι τὸ σῶμα σ. Arist. Phgn. 805a6; εἰ [ὅλον τὸ σῶμα] σ. τι τῇ ἀκοῇ Thphr. Sens. 57; τοῖς ἀναπνευστικοῖς ὀργάνοις τὸ ἧπαρ σ. Gal. 18(1).25, cf. 16.555, Sor. 2.20, al.

data.quote: εἰ [ὅλον τὸ σῶμα] σ. τι τῇ ἀκοῇ

children.label: III
children.definition: have a fellow-feeling, sympathize, feel sympathy, Pl. R. 605d, Antiph. 84, Sor. 1.4. Cf. συμπαθέω.
strike together, clap, χειρῶν -ουσῶν (v.l. συμπλατ-) S.E. M. 6.20, cf. Hsch.; v. συμπλαταγέω.
strike along with or together, E. Supp. 699.

tread together, as clothes in washing, Cratin. 275; trample under foot, γέννημα φρύνου Babr. 28.1; σταφυλάς Gp. 8.23.1: metaph., κόσμον Clearch. 3; τινας OGI 519.30 ( Aragueni, iii A.D.):— Pass., to be trampled under foot, as by horses, etc., Aeschin. 3.164, Thphr. HP 8.7.5, Plb. 1.34.7, J. AJ 9.6.4, etc.
fellow-countryman, Archipp. 54.
fellow-πατρονόμος, τῷ θεῷ Λυκούργῳ BSA 27.226 ( Sparta, ii A.D.): c.gen., ib. 239.
cease together with, τινι Gal. UP 12.15.
make thick together, Hp. Morb. 4.52:— Pass., τῇ σελήνῃ ὁ αἴλουρος σ. Demetr. Eloc. 158.
bind together, bind hand and foot, Onos. 11.3, etc.:— Pass., Plu. Fac.lun. 2.924f.
benumb, v.l. for συνεπόδισεν, X. An. 4.4.11.
adjacent to a plain, [sc. γᾶ] IG 12(2).74 B 6 (Mytil., iii B.C.).
obedient also, σ. ἔχειν τὸν κάμνοντα Pall. in Hp. 2.109 D.

definition: συμπείθω, pf. part. -πεπεικυῖα Hyp. Ath. 4 ( aor. part. συμπείσας is f.l. for συμπιέσας in Plu. Gen.Socr. 2.580d):—

children.definition: win by persuasion, persuade, abs., Pl. Lg. 720d: c. acc. pers., Lycurg. 102, UPZ 114i22 (ii B.C.), Plu. Cam. 23: c. acc. rei, τὰ μὲν συμπείθων, τὰ δὲ βιαζόμενος X. Mem. 2.4.6; σ. τἀναντία D.H. 6.49; ταῦτα συμπείθεις με σύ; Men. Epit. 527: c. acc. pers. et inf., σ. πολλοὺς ὁμογνωμονεῖν X. Cyr. 2.2.24, cf. Aeschin. 3.142, D. 18.147, IG 12(7).386.15 ( Amorgos, iii B.C.):— Pass., join in a view, Arist. Pol. 1307b15; allow oneself to be persuaded, c. inf., ib. 1296a38; τι to a thing, Aeschin. 3.71, SIG 364.96 ( Ephesus, iii B.C.): c. dat., to be convinced of . ., Phld. Mus. p.89K.: abs., Demetr.Com.Vet. 4; συμπεπεισμένοι καθʼ ἡμῶν Luc. JTr. 45; τὸ -πεπεισμένον the sum agreed, BGU 1163.8 (i B.C.); συνεπείσθησαν πρὸς ἀλλήλας μὴ ἐγκαλεῖν Sammelb. 7338.10 (iii/iv A.D.).

data.quote: τὰ μὲν συμπείθων, τὰ δὲ βιαζόμενος

children.definition: acquainted with, ἀγωνίᾳ Pi. N. 7.10.
pierce through together, Plu. Cam. 41, Q.S. 1.612.

send or dispatch along with or at the same time, ὕμνον Pi. I. 5(4).63; ὀπάονας A. Supp. 493; πρεσβείαν IG 2(2).1.24 (v B.C.): c. dat. pers., νεηνίας καὶ κύνας σ. ἡμῖν Hdt. 1.36; τοῖσι παισὶ φύλακον Id. 8.104, cf. 5.80, PCair.Zen. 230.4 (iii B.C.), 2 Ep.Cor. 8.22; ἀγωγούς τινι Th. 2.12; φύλακας X. Cyr. 1.4.7, cf. HG 1.4.21 ( Pass.).
help in conducting, τὴν πομπήν Is. 6.50, Lys. 13.80; συμπέμψοντες τὴν Πυθαΐδα SIG 697 B ( Delph., ii B.C.).
join in mourning for, τοὺς τεθνεῶτας Isoc. 8.87, cf. Lycurg. 43.

children.label: II
children.definition: mourn together, τινι with one, A. Ch. 199: abs., E. HF 1390, D. 60.33.
to be poor along with another in a thing, τινί τινος Pl. Men. 71b.
five together, by fives, v.l. in Hyp. Fr. 124.
come to a head, Hp. Epid. 6.1.10, Ruf. ap. Orib. 45.30.27:— Act., bring to a head, Ruf. Ren.Ves. 2.8.
complicatedly, Gal. 19.489: c. dat., in conjunction with, Hermog. Stat. 4.
promoting digestion, digestive, Gal. 14.694, 764.
dissolving, οἰδημάτων Dsc. 2.86.
Gal. 12.101, v.l. for συμπέττω in Dsc. 1.54.

accomplish jointly, τι Isoc. 4.171, v.l. in E. Med. 887:— Med., συμπεραναμένων τῶν . . συνεργῶν αὐτῷ τὴν πρὸς Θηβαίους ἔχθραν had effectually helped him to create the ill-feeling, D. 18.163; ἀπέραντα ξυμπεραίνῃ Luc. Philops. 9:— Pass., to be accomplished simultaneously, τὰ συμπερανθέντα τάχη Pl. Ti. 39d.
finish, work out, ἐπειδὰν συμπεράνωμεν ( -αίνωμεν codd.) τὸν . . λόγον Gal. 6.214:— Pass., ib. 15.

children.label: II
children.definition: decide or conclude absolutely, ξ. φροντίδα make up oneʼs mind, E. Med. 341; σ. καὶ κλώθειν ἑκάστῳ τὰ οἰκεῖα Arist. Mu. 401b21; κλῇθρα μοχλοῖς make the doors doubly sure by bars, E. Or. 1551 (troch.); ὁ συμπεραίνων (sc. ἀριθμός) the last counted, in a series, Speus. ap. Theol.Ar. 62:— Pass., to be quite finished, X. Cyr. 6.1.31.

data.quote: σ. καὶ κλώθειν ἑκάστῳ τὰ οἰκεῖα

children.definition: Med. συμπεραίνεσθαι conclude syllogistically, draw conclusions, Arist. APr. 57b20, EN 1094b22:— Pass., to be so concluded, Id. Ph. 186a24; τὸ συμπερανθέν the conclusion drawn, Id. EN 1146a26; ἔστω συμπεπερασμένον Id. APr. 42a8; σ. τι κατά τινος ib. 66a38.

children.label: III
children.definition: Act., extend equally far, Id. HA 541a2.
conclude along with or together, διάνοιαν Demetr. Eloc. 2, cf. Stob. 4.44.74:— Pass., to be concluded together, Ph. 2.374, Nech. ap. Vett.Val. 279.7, etc.; ἔν τινι Phot. Bibl. p.21 B.
conclusion, sum, τῶν ἐτῶν Vett.Val. 137.24.
one must conclude, Gal. Nat.Fac. 3.11.
tending to a conclusion, only in Adv. -κῶς in the form of a conclusion, εἰπεῖν Arist. SE 174b11.
finishing, end, Ocell. 1.3, Hierocl. in CA 20p.463M., Eust. 73.27, etc.; τοῦ ἐνιαυτοῦ, τῶν ἑορτῶν, Ph. 2.298, 278; of a letter, Jul. Ep. 183.

children.label: II
children.definition: conclusion in a syllogism, Arist. APr. 30a5, 42a5 sq., Top. 155b23, al., Stoic. 2.78, Gal. 15.550,633.
subject of the conclusion, Arist. APr. 53a17.

children.label: III
children.definition: conclusion of a proposition, Procl. in Euc. p.75 F., al., Hero *Deff. 136.13.
indicating the conclusion, of the particle ἄρα, Sch. E. Hec. 511; of ὥστε, Simp. in Ph. 335.31; σ. ὅρος definition embodying conclusion of syllogism, Asp. in EN 49.3. Adv. -κῶς Arist. Rh. 1401a3.

definition: συμπερασμός, ὁ, f.l. for συμπέρασμα, Artem. 3.58.

children.definition: Phlp. in de An. 588.4.
cross a river together, Lex. ap. Plot. de Pulchr. p.134 Creuzer.
destroy with or together, E. Hel. 106 (tm.).
curved so as to coincide with, τινι Ph. Bel. 63.27.
to be curved all round, -νύμενος κόλπος Sch. D.P. 121.

carry about along with or together, X. Oec. 8.12, Theo Sm. p.151 H.:— Pass., to be so carried, go round with or together, X. Cyr. 4.3.1, Arist. Mete. 344a12; τῇ στρατιᾷ Arr. An. 4.14.3:— Med., lead about with oneself, X. Hier. 2.8, D.C. 77.7, etc.
revolution in the same sense with, Simp. in Cael. 500.19, Phlp. in Mete. 90.25.
assistant in converting others, Pl. R. 533d.
one must strip off, Theon Prog. p.84S.
cover all round together, Dsc. Eup. 2.20, Gal. 18(2).896.
buzz about together, Them. Or. 2.36a.

definition: συμπεριγίγνομαι, aor. part. -γενόμενον glossed by συμπεριλαμβανόμενον, Hsch.

children.definition: circumscribe or cancel together with, τοῖς ἄλλοις ἑαυτήν S.E. P. 1.14, cf. Plot. 6.5.11.
to be whirled round with or together, Ti.Locr. 96d, Ach.Tat. Intr.Arat. 39:—also συμπερι-δονέομαι, Cass. Pr. 60.
wrap round also, Orib. 49.28.10.
go round with, κυνί X. Cyn. 10.4, cf. Them. Or. 25.310c: c. acc., τὸ τεῖχος Aen.Tact. 38.2.
drag about together, in Pass., c. dat., PSI 5.495.16 (iii B.C.), Placit. 2.20.13.
one must accommodate oneself to, ἀγνώμονι πατρί Socr. ap. Stob. 4.25.42.
go round together, τὰς Ἄλπεις App. BC 5.20 codd. (dub. l.); σ. τινί go round with . . , Cleom. 1.11.
embrace in the same circuit, D.H. 3.43, in Pass.
gird round oneself, gird oneself with, Ath. 12.551d.
revolve with, M.Ant. 7.47, Jul. Or. 4.150b; run about with, ἄνω καὶ κάτω Luc. Merc.Cond. 24; τινι App. BC 4.18.
fly about with, ταῖς ἀκρίσιν Zos. 1.57.
close in, draw together, Thphr. HP 5.5.2.
move round together, Cass. Pr. 27.
include together, Sch. Luc. Anach. 17, Tz. H. 6.399.
convey round with, IG 11(2).165.6 ( Delos, iii B.C.).

gather together, τὸ τοῦ ἱματίου περικεχυμένον Sor. Vit.Hippocr. 12; enclose or include together, [ τοῖς νεύροις] ὀστᾶ καὶ μυελόν Pl. Ti. 74d, cf. Hp. Fist. 4; τὰ ᾠά Arist. HA 549a33; πολλὴν ἀναθυμίασιν Id. Mete. 358a33:— Pass., Pl. Ti. 83d.

embrace, include, τὰ γένη ib. 58a; comprehend in a treaty with others, ἐν ταῖς συνθήκαις Philipp. ap. D. 18.77 ( Pass.), cf. Decr. ap. eund. 18.29, Epicur. Nat. 28.9; embrace in the same history, Plb. 8.11.4, cf. D.S. 16.94, etc.:— Pass., ἐν τῷ λόγῳ συμπεριειλῆφθαι Arist. Top. 142a31, cf. Thphr. HP 6.1.1, al.; ὅπως -ληφθῶμεν ἐν ταῖς συνθήκαις SIG 591.64 ( Lampsacus, ii B.C.).
embrace, Act. Ap. 20.10.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., take part in together, τινος Luc. Dom. 4 codd. συμπερι-ληπτέον, one must include, Thphr. HP 6.6.1.
release, dub.l. in POxy. 259.25 (i A.D.).
consider well with or together, M.Ant. 8.36.
go round together with, follow along with, τινι Luc. Tox. 56, cf. Them. Or. 11.146a, etc.; σ. τῇ σκιᾷ τῆς γῆς Cleom. 1.11; σ. ἡμῖν ὁ λόγος Paus. 5.14.10.
come round together with, ἀμπώτεις σ. τῇ σελήνῃ Arist. Mu. 396a26; travel together with, PSI 5.502.15 (iii B.C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be described at the same time, c. dat., Str. 17.1.1, 17.2.1.
walk round or about with, τινι Pl. Prt. 314e, Men. 117: abs., τοὺς συμπεριπατοῦντας their companions in walking round, Arist. Rh. 1409b24, cf. J. Vit. 63, Them. Or. 22.269b.
fly about with, ib. Them. Or. 19.233a (with vv.ll.).
fall about together, Hypsaeus ap. Stob. 4.31.45.
wander about together, v.l. in Ph. 1.16.
embrace, ἐν ἀγάπαις Thd. Pr. 7.18.
sail about with, c. dat., App. BC 5.96, Ps.- Hdt. Vit.Hom. 8.
inter-connexion, τῶν πραγμάτων Luc. Hist.Conscr. 55.
help in procuring, τὴν ἀρχήν τινι Plb. 3.49.9, cf. D.S. 11.81.

go round together with, τοῖς ἄστροις Phld. D. 3.9; τῷ ἡλίῳ Cat.Cod.Astr. 1.136; accompany, Ph. 1.16 ( -ποληθείς, v.l. -πλανηθείς), Plu. QConv. 2.745e, etc.:—hence συμπερι-πόλησις, εως, ἡ, Procl. in Alc. p.138C., Herm. in Phdr. p.92A., Dam. Pr. 370.
fellow-περίπολος, Philol. 71.92 (Phocis, pl.), cf. Them. Or. 13.165b.
to circumflex also, A.D. Adv. 170.10:— Pass., c. dat., Id. Synt. 335.18, EM 171.39.
by reason of sharing the circumflex accent, A.D. Adv. 175.23.
help in cloaking, ἁμαρτίας Plb. 10.22.9.
revolve along with, τῷ οὐρανῷ, of the fixed stars, Arist. Mu. 392a10, cf. Gem. 5.62; τὸ πῦρ τῇ δίνῃ Plu. Fac.lun. 2.927c; of pain in colic, Gal. 8.384.
help in walling round, Plu. Tim. 9.

put round together, σ. ὄγκον αὐτῷ καὶ δόξαν take part in getting honour for another, Plu. Nic. 5:— Pass., -τιθεμένων τῶν στεμφύλων τῷ ἀγγείῳ Dsc. 1.57:—the Act. is dub. l. in Nech. ap. Vett.Val. 290.21.
overthrow together with, ἑαυτήν τισι S.E. P. 2.188, cf. 193 ( Pass.):— Pass. also, of leaves of heliotrope, τῇ τοῦ ἡλίου κλίσει Dsc. 4.190 (v.l. -φερ-).
run round together, Luc. Dem.Enc. 37, Cat.Cod.Astr. 11(2).178.
to be rubbed up together, Gal. 13.1041 (citing Dsc. 1.57, where συμπεριτιθεμένων).
fall in with at the same time, τινι v.l. in X. An. 7.8.22.
form conceptions of also, M.Ant. 10.38.
circular, χρῶμα, of the ἅλως, Olymp. in Mete. 226.20.
carry round along with or together, Pl. R. 404c, Arist. HA 548a19, Thphr. HP 7.5.2; οἱ συμπεριφέροντες τὴν ὄψιν ταχὺ σκοτοῦνται Id. Vert. 7.

data.quote: οἱ συμπεριφέροντες τὴν ὄψιν ταχὺ σκοτοῦνται

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be carried round together, Pl. R. 617b; συμπεριφέρεσθαι περιφοράν Id. Phdr. 248a; τὸν αὐτὸν κύκλον Epicur. Ep. 2p.53U.; τοῖς φανεροῖς ἄστροις with . ., Placit. 2.13.9; τὰ ἀπλανῆ συμπεριφέρεται τῷ οὐρανῷ Stoic. 2.195, cf. Theo Sm. p.134 H.; σ. [τοῦ ἡλιοσκοπίου] ἡ κόμη τῇ τοῦ ἡλίου κλίσει Dsc. 4.164, cf. 190 (v.l. for -τρεπ-); τοῦ ὄμματος περιφερομένου συμπεριφέρεσθαι καὶ τὰς ὄψεις Hero *Deff. 135.10.

data.quote: σ. [τοῦ ἡλιοσκοπίου] ἡ κόμη τῇ τοῦ ἡλίου κλίσει
τοῦ ὄμματος περιφερομένου συμπεριφέρεσθαι καὶ τὰς ὄψεις

children.definition: συμπεριφέρεσθαί τινι go about with one, have intercourse with one, live in his society, Plb. 2.17.12, 4.35.7, 5.15.2, Ath. 12.548a, Hierocl. in CA 9p.432M.; of a kingʼs intercourse with a queen, D.S. 17.77; of a queenʼs intercourse with her husband and her son, OGI 308.13 ( Hierapolis, ii B.C.); συμπεριενεχθῆναι εἴς τινα εὐχρώμως prob. in PRyl. 237.8 (iii A.D.).

accommodate or adapt oneself to, τοῖς καιροῖς σ. πρὸς τὸ κράτιστον Aeschin. 2.164, cf. PEnteux. 45.6 (iii B.C.), SIG 707.10 ( Olbia, ii B.C.), Inscr.Prien. 135 (i B.C.); ταῖς ἐνισχυούσαις δόξαις Phld. Piet. 27; τοῖς πράγμασιν ἐλαφρῶς καὶ μετρίως Plu. Tranq. 2.468e; καλῶς -οισθησόμεθα τοῖς τῆς φύσεως Polystr. Herc. 346 p. 89 V. (fr. 3 col. 13a): abs., show indulgence, IPE 12.32 A31 ( Olbia, iii B.C.), Musée Belge 11.99 ( Ceos, iii B.C.), OGI 244.16 ( Daphne, ii B.C.): c. dat. pers., PCair.Zen. 367.10 (iii B.C.).

data.quote: τοῖς καιροῖς σ. πρὸς τὸ κράτιστον

children.definition: understand and follow, be conversant with, τοῖς πολιτικοῖς πράγμασιν Phld. Rh. 2.49 S.; τοῖς λεγομένοις, τοῖς παραγγελλομένοις, Plb. 3.10.2, 10.23.9.
go about with any one to oneʼs own ruin, Luc. Pseudol. 18, Ath. 7.289c; cf. φθείρω II.
intercourse, companionship, society, Plb. 5.26.15, Phld. Hom. p.21 O., D.S. 3.64: pl., social intercourse, Phld. Ind.Sto. 3, Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).178.

accommodating temper, indulgence, complaisance, UPZ 110.44 (ii B.C.), Plb. 1.72.2, 23.2.10, Plu. Sanit. 2.124b, POxy. 1590.5 (iv A.D.); ἡ τῶν νόμων σ. Epicur. (?) Oxy. 215 ii7; κατὰ -ὰν λέγειν Phld. Piet. 115; ἡ πρὸς τὰ τέκνα σ. καὶ ὁμόνοια OGI 308.17 ( Hierapolis, ii B.C.); ὄχλων Jul. Or. 6.200c; σ. ποιεῖσθαι χρημάτων to be indulgent in demanding repayment, IG 12(5).860.14 ( Tenos, i B.C.).

data.quote: ἡ πρὸς τὰ τέκνα σ. καὶ ὁμόνοια

children.definition: accommodating, complaisant, Apollon. Lex. s.v. συμφερτή.
fence all round or together, Arist. Phgn. 811a8 (v.l.).
pin together, χεῖρας θυρεοῖς συμπεπερονημένας Plu. Crass. 25, cf. Apollod. Poliorc. 168.6, Them. Or. 21.253a.

mature by heating, cooking, ὁμαλῦναι καὶ συμπέψαι Arist. Mete. 381a20, cf. HA 625a6, Thphr. HP 8.7.7; concoct, bring to a head, etc., Dsc. 2.86, Gal. 6.247,825, 15.889; hatch eggs, Arist. HA 549b7, cf. 560b17 ( Pass.), GA 752b17; ἡ γῆ σ. τῇ θερμότητι ib. 753a19, cf. 752b33 ( Pass.); promote digestion, Thphr. HP 6.3.6, Od. 49:— Pass., Arist. PA 677b27, HA 590a21; of food, to be digested, Id. Mete. 379b23.
spread out with or together, Aen.Tact. 37.9.
fly with or together, Luc. Musc.Enc. 6, Ael. NA 2.48; νεβροῖς Philostr. Im. 2.2.
closely pressed together, Gloss. Adv. -ως eclectically, σ. γέγραφε Thphr. Fr. 41.
concoction of crude humours, Gal. 17(2).712, 18(2).273, Alex.Trall. 4.1.
Heliod. ap. Orib. 49.4.39, al., Gal. 8.849.
framework, superstructure, Apollod. Poliorc. 166.6, dub. l. in Ar.Byz. Epit. 16.2.

definition: συμπήγνυμι and συμπηγνύω ( Arist. Resp. 472a34, Epicur. Nat. 14.5):—

children.definition: put together, construct, frame, τάφον E. Supp. 938; ψεύσταν λόγον Pi. N. 5.29; στέγασμα Pl. Ti. 73d; σύριγγα Theoc. 8.23, etc.; τινὰ ἐξ ἄλλων Epicur. l.c.; τὴν οὐσίαν ἐκ . . Plu. Col. 2.1118e:— Med., construct for oneself, δίφρον Critias 2.11, cf. Luc. D Deor. 24[25].3, Am. 53; μηχανάς App. Mith. 30.
